We feel it's im- portant because it continues the dialogue about the immigrant experience shifting between cultures, and ex- plores the complexities of language, communication and identity.Babellodrome est un spectacle francophone participatif, multimédia et multilingue présenté par le collectif BUS 1.2.3. en collaboration avec le chœur Element. La performance interactive in situ se penche sur la question suivante: dans le chaos médiatique et globalisé actuel, dans un monde où s'entrechoquent fiction et réalité (réelle et virtuelle) jusqu'aux "faits alternatifs" et aux "nouvelles fictives", quelles sont nos réalités... comment se définir en opposition aux propagandes commerciales et politiques? Alliant poésie, humour et fantaisie, ce spectacle aborde la question sous forme de tableaux dialogués, visuels et musicaux, avec participation du public.Les projections vidéo à grande échelle et la musique en direct en font un spectacle unique et intriguant qui inspire l’imaginaire d’un public de tout âge. Cette performance foisonne de personnages tantôt parodiques, tantôt mythiques, qui cheminent au travers des nouvelles technologies à la recherche de leur identité.En cours de route, les protagonistes vivent de multiples péripéties: problèmes de communication, traductions erronées, jeux insensés et publicités fictives. Au moment où leur quête culmine, ils retrouvent leur nature véritable, dénudée de tout artifice médiatique: une renaissance de l’essentiel.
Our Goals/ Nos Objectifs:
There are three main goals to the project:The first goal is interaction with the public. We believe that members of the audience complement and com- plete the performance by participating in it and moving through the piece going from one scene to the other. The audience will be involved making sounds from typewriters according to timings determined by the per- formers, playing an abstract version of scrabble, and participating in a fake conference. They'll be asked to answer questions, tell stories, translate sentences.... By including them in the action of the piece, we hope to invite them to begin their own questioning on the themes of the piece.
The second goal is to have the location transform the piece. The benefit of performing in a site specific loca- tion is that it gives us the opportunity to draw from the area's local history and architecture and use the local environment to inform the work.
The third goal is to collaborate with Christine Duncan and the Element Choir, and Kathy Kennedy and the Choeur Maha. We feel we share the same creative processes that would greatly benefit this production, both in amplifying and complementing the themes of the project as well as bringing an inter-generational and multi-disciplinary element to the piece. 
Le premier objectif est l'interaction avec le public. Nous croyons que le public complémente et complète la performance en y participant tout en se déplaçant d'une scène à l'autre. Les spectacles pop-up intégreront lee membres du public en les mpliquant dans la production de sons à partir de machines à écrire, en jouant une version abstraite de Scrabble et en participant à une fausse conférence. On leur demandera de répondre aux questions, de raconter des histoires, de traduire des phrases ... En les incluant dans l'action de la pièce, nous espérons les inciter à leur propre questionnement par rapport aux thèmes de la pièce.
Le deuxième objectif est de permettre au site de transformer la pièce. L'avantage de se produire dans un emplacement spécifique est qu'il nous donne l'opportunité de s'inspirer de l'histoire et de l'architecture locales afin d'informer l’installation et le déroulement de la performance.
Le troisième objectif est de collaborer avec Christine Duncan et le choeur Element. Nous estimons que nous partageons les mêmes processus créatifs qui profiteraient grandement à cette production, à la fois en amplifiant et en complétant les thèmes du projet et en apportant un élément intergénérationnel et multidisciplinaire à la pièce.
 Collectif BUS 1.2.3:
Collectif BUS 1.2.3.,based in Toronto, is a multi-lingual and multimedia not-for-profit professional collective formed in 1991. The group presented BUS 1.2.3, its first creation, at the Festival of Independent Dance Artists (fFIDA) in Toronto the following year. The play questioned the influence of new technologies on society at a time when the Internet was still in its infancy. 
Twenty years later, many of the original members of the collective came together again to remount the piece and update it according to current issues. Thanks to several grants from the Ontario Arts Council (2012-2015) and a project grant from the Canada Council, the collective was able to conduct several intensive research residencies, based on improvisation and collaborative creation techniques. It went on to develop a finished theatrical piece presented in a theatrical setting in 2015. The new work, building on themes of language, communication and identity, became a multi-generational, multi-lingual and multimedia production titled Babelle et Barbarie. It was presented at the Winchester St. Theatre for four nights in September 2015. The collective then decided to re-imagine the work for the public space and focus on public participation. This new piece is title "Babelledrome."
The original piece was built on improvisation, a creative process the collective decided to keep. Motivated by the desire to critique media's place in contemporary society, the collective retains elements of its previous creations (videos, recordings, musical compositions and songs ...) and reintegrates them in new projects under development. The scenic writing of the collective is based on a rich language constructed from several vocabularies, including video, music, text and performance, exploring the themes of the piece in a multi-sensory technological environment. This approach requires collaboration between singers, actors, musicians and videographer; an approach the group has been practicing since its inception. The performance doesn't therefore rest solely on text and is thus more akin to performance art than conventional theatre.
Le collectif BUS 1.2.3 est un collectif multidisciplinaire et multilingue formé en 1991. Il a présenté sa première création BUS 1.2.3 au fringe Festival of Independant Dance Artists (fFIDA) à Toronto l'année suivante. La pièce questionnait la place des nouvelles technologies dans la société contemporaine au moment de la naissance d’Internet.
Vingt ans plus tard, des membres originaux du collectif se sont réunis afin de reprendre la pièce et d’en actualiser les enjeux. Cette nouvelle collaboration a conduit à la création du spectacle multilingue Babelle et Barbarie (B+B) présenté en septembre 2015 au Winchester St. Theatre à Toronto. Les thèmes utilisés cette fois-ci portaient sur le langage, l’identité et la communication. Après ces représentations, le collectif a décidé de poursuivre sa réflexion en ré-imaginant l’oeuvre dans l’espace public et en se concentrant sur la participation du public.
La pièce originelle avait été bâtie sur un travail d’improvisation, processus créatif que le collectif a décidé de conserver. Réuni par la volonté de proposer une réflexion sur la place des médias, le collectif conserve des éléments de ses précédentes créations (vidéos, enregistrement, compositions musicales et chantées…) et les réintègrent dans les nouveaux projets en cours de développement. La démarche du collectif est ainsi inscrite dans le temps et s’adapte aux nouveaux enjeux technologiques et aux nouveaux comportements des publics.
L’écriture scénique du collectif s'appuie sur un langage fécond s'abreuvant à plusieurs vocabulaires, dont celui de la vidéo, de la musique, du texte et de la performance, explorant les thèmes de la pièce dans un environnement technologique multi sensoriel.
Cette approche exige une confrontation entre chanteuses, comédiens, musiciens et vidéaste ; un travail collaboratif tel que le groupe le pratique depuis ses débuts. Le spectacle s'apparente ainsi plus à de la performance scénique qu'à un théâtre conventionnel où tout reposerait sur le textuel.
Christine Duncan and the Element Choir:
The Element Choir is an improvising choir from Toronto led by vocalist Christine Duncan. This is a group that works with both structured and non-structured elements, based primarily on a system of conduction cues. As an ensemble they explore textural and timbral sound qualities, soundscapes, rhythmic patterns, sound poetry, group and individual composition ideas, musical genre interplay and extended voice techniques. This cinematic approach to group vocalizing presents both tonal and non-tonal material in a constantly evolving and ‘in the moment’ sonic environment.
A musical chameleon with a near five octave range, Christine Duncan uses her voice as an instrument, exploring its full tonal, timbral and textural range. She is involved with everything from jazz, R&B, gospel, improvised music, sound poetry, to new music and musique actuelle.She performs with many musical groups and projects, most notably Hugh Fraser’s VEJI (Vancouver Ensemble of Jazz Improvisation) and Barnyard Drama with drummer/electronic artist Jean Martin. Christine also teaches voice in the jazz programs at Humber College and the University of Toronto.
The Element Choir has performed and recorded with Tanya Tagaq, as well as participated in the Apocalysis (Luminato Festival) Barnyard Drama, with Tim Berne and Snake Oil,  Shelter Opera (Tapestry New Opera), Hard Rubber Orchestra tribute to Kenny Wheeler, Veryan Weston,  Inverted Mountains, with Coleman Lemieux & Compagnie, Idiolalla West Coast Tour with DB Boyko,  L’Off Festival (Montreal) and William Parker (Guelph Jazz Festival)
Le chœur Element est une chorale d'improvisation basée à Toronto et dirigée par la chanteuse Christine Duncan. Il s'agit d'un groupe qui fonctionne avec des éléments structurés et non structurés, fondés principalement sur un système de signaux de conduction. Ensemble, les choristes explorent des paysages sonores par la texture et le timbre, les motifs rythmiques, la poésie sonore, les idées de composition en groupe et individuelles, l'interaction des genres musicaux et les techniques de voix. Cette approche cinématographique de la vocalisation de groupe présente des matériaux à la fois tonale et non tonale dans un environnement sonore en direct et en évolution constante.
Un caméléon musical avec une gamme d'environ cinq octaves, Christine Duncan utilise sa voix comme instrument, en explorant sa gamme tonale, timbrale et texturale complète. Elle est impliquée dans tous les genres musicaux, du jazz au R & B, du gospel à la musique improvisée, et de la poésie sonore à la musique contemporaine et la musique actuelle.
Elle participe à de nombreux groupes et projets musicaux, notamment le VEJI de Hugh Fraser (Ensemble d’Improvisation Jazz de Vancouver) et Barnyard Drama avec le batteur / artiste électronique Jean Martin. Christine enseigne également la voix dans les programmes de jazz au Humber College et à l'Université de Toronto.
Le chœur Element a joué et enregistré avec Tanya Tagaq, ainsi que participé à Apocalypsis (Luminato Festival), Théâtre Barnyard, avec Tim Berne et Snake Oil, Shelter Opera (Tapestry New Opera), hommage à Kenny Wheeler avec Hard Rubber Orchestra, Veryan Weston, Inverted Mountains avec Coleman Lemieux & Compagnie, Idiolalla (tournée sur la côte Ouest avec DB Boyko), L'Off Festival (Montréal) et William Parker (Festival de Jazz de Guelph).
What your money will help achieve / Ce que votre argent nous aidera à réaliser :
Your donation will help us to achieve our goals of putting on this production next June and/or July, and the money raised will be used for rehearsals and testing how to best integrate audience participation and interactivity into the show. We have also been awarded a grant from the Ontario Arts Council for the actual performance, and are applying for further grants. Yet we are short of our planned budget of $48 000 to make this show a realization and your help will go towards achieving this. If, unfortunately, the full budget cannot be achieved, we will adjust the performance to fit  into the budget constraints. However, we still need your help for the research and development stage of the project.
Votre don nous aidera à atteindre nos objectifs de mise en production en juin et / ou juillet prochains, et l'argent recueilli sera utilisé pour les répétitions et tester la meilleure façon d'intégrer la participation et l'interactivité du public au spectacle. Nous avons également reçu une subvention du Conseil des arts de l'Ontario pour les représentations et nous demandons d'autres subventions. Pourtant, nous sommes à court de notre budget prévu de 48 000 $ pour que ce spectacle soit réalisé et votre aide sera versée à cette fin. Si, malheureusement, le budget total ne peut être atteint, nous allons modifier la performance pour tenir compte des contraintes budgétaires. Cependant, nous avons encore besoin de votre aide pour la phase de recherche et de développement du projet.
Other ways that you can help / Autres moyens que vous pouvez aider:
We will be looking for volunteers to help run the show next year in June/July. If you wish to help please contact info@collectifbus123.com

story:
International Improv

We are a collaboration of experienced international improvisers each bringing our own style of play to this project. Our goal is to bridge the gap between our communities through the power of improv comedy.  Through our support of one another we are creating a sense of global community.  Hoopla Impro has granted us the opportunity to share the stage for one night in London.

Meet the ensemble:

  • Katy Schutte – London, ENG: The Maydays, Hoopla, Project2 and author of The Improviser’s Way: A Longform Workbook.
  • Victoria Bang – Gothenburg, SWE: Gbgimprov and Hall and the Bang.
  • Rhiannon Vivian –London, ENG: The Maydays, The Bumper Blyton Improvised Adventure, Dreamweaver Quartet, Newsical, and Hoopla.
  • Gosia Róża Różalska –Gdynia, PL: Ohana, 7 Women in Different Ages, and Young Improv.
  • Vanessa Anton – San Diego, USA: Finest City Improv, Swim Team and Found Family.
  • David Escobedo: Los Angeles, CA - The Deets, M.I.'s Westside Comedy, and Wretched Hive Improv.
  • AJ Orta: West Covina, CA - #Likeable, Wretched Hive Improv
  • Shane Geller –Long Beach, USA: Funny People Society, #Likeable, Spec Script, and The Wretched Hive Improv.

Your Help

Touring costs can add up quickly. On top of flight and hotel there are also additional transportation costs, promotion costs, meals, etc. All of us are working professionals however, this type of show takes a massive investment of time and finances.

Here is exactly where all your support will go:

  • $40 X 9 Oyster  Cards  - One for each performer to be able to get to rehearsals, workshops and the performance.
  • $20 X 9 Team Dinner – As a "thank you" for taking the risk and time to be a part of the project we would love to celebrate with a Team Dinner.
  • $60 Online Promotion
  • All additional money will be transparently distributed for performer’s costs of hotel and flight.

Donation Perks! The more you donate the more you receive!! Here are some of the perks:

  • Social Media Shout Out – making an impact with over 48,6000 followers on Twitter and over 22,200 followers on Facebook.
  • "Improv International" shirt
  • Online improv lesson videos
  • Manage Your Twitter Account - David works in social media, and can increase the followers/impressions for your improv company, troupe, or individual page.

For many of us this will be our first international improv show, and with your help we can do something fantastic.

Other Ways You Can Be a Part of the Project

The goal of this world is to use improv comedy as a common language. There is so much anxiety in the world, that maybe we can improv not just a part of your local community, but to make your local community a part of global improv.

  • You can share our posts about the campaign - this does so much for us. 
  • You can be part of the dialogue and network - if this is successful, maybe we can do it again and make it bigger.  Instead of a local improv festival maybe an international improv gathering.
  • Support your local teams - especially the smaller teams. It's easy to give the house team with well-known improv performers a chance.  Many times it's the smaller teams that need your support during the shows but also on line!
  • Get in touch with us about future projects! - we are all active improv influencers that perform, produce shows, tours... we could also use a new friend in a new city.

story:
Embrace Us! Ruby's Arms at a Glance

Be a part of the magic.

Your contribution will shed light upon the goal we are trying to reach in telling this beautifully compelling story and working with a cast that resonates passion, integrity and true talent. 

10 years in the making, Barry Papick partners with Sandy Duarte to share with the world his story of love, passion and hardship through his juicy words and delicious narrative, stringed through thought-provoking and heart-turning monologues, bounced through characters that will keep you curious long after the curtain drops.

"I figured Hollywood would be this place of dreams. Beauty and dreams. But it wasn’t like that. You couldn’t trust a goddamned soul. I had a boss who constantly tried to fuck me. No, no I mean, you know steal money from my tip jar, beat me out of a couple hours on my check. And an agent who, I think, had his eyes on the perfect body. They all seemed to be stroking you and fucking you at the same time. Sort of the worst kind of lover, the kind you can’t trust. This town is the kind of lover that lies to you with a smile on its face and it’s hand on your dick." - Ruby's Arms

  • BARRY PAPICK / Writer, Director, Producer

"Barry Papick's ability to communicate the deepest truth makes him an extremely talented and invaluable actor" - Gus VanSant/Director (Good Will Hunting, Finding Forrestor...)

"Barry’s passion for his craft and the joy he brings to his work should be an inspiration for all actors" - Andrew Niccol/Director-Writer (…Simone, Gattaca, The Truman Show)

"To prepare for the role, Gregory says, he had long sessions with acting coach Barry Papick. "He took me very deep inside myself. It got so intense that even he was crying." - Dick Gregory, British GQ

Barry Papick is a highly respected, accomplished actor having been in over 20 Feature Films, 20 stage plays and many episodic television shows including Swans Crossing, where he was a series regular and recently, Shameless. Barry has been seen in Labor Pains with Lindsey Lohan, Lake Effects on The Hallmark Channel and has guest starred on the CBS show Without A Trace. He can be seen in Howard Stern’s Private Parts and Andrew Niccol’s Simone.

One of the top Acting Coaches in the world, Barry has been teaching and coaching Actors for 23 years.

Last year he was the On-set coach for three feature films. Barry has coached for television shows such as The West Wing, The Wire, Malcolm in the Middle, Body of Proof, Brothers and Sisters, Burn Notice, The Originals and many, many more.  Barry has also been the personal On-set coach for Gus VanSant and Adam Sandler's Happy Madison Productions. He has worked with many actors including Sean Connery, Rob Brown, Jamie Foxx, Anna Paquin, Lindsey Lohan, Dennis Quaid, Ione Skye, Sonja Sohn, RZA and Darrin Dewitt Henson (to name a few). 

Barry's undeniable gift as an actor has made him a perfectly rounded creative force as a writer, director and teacher. Under his direction, Ruby's Arms will be an unforgettable experience for the cast and You, the valued audience. 

  • SANDY DUARTE / Producer, Actress

"Sandy Duarte plays Noelle. Her performance is powerful. She is dominant and controlling. She is a gifted, charismatic and passionate woman" - Mooney on Theatre

"there’s no denying the play’s power, especially when Duarte’s middle-class Elizabeth begins unpacking her own psychological baggage" - Now Toronto

Sandy Duarte is the Winner of the prestigious Dora Mavor Moore Award [Canada's Tony Award] for her Outstanding Female Performance in the iconic production of Blood written by Tom Walmsley. Her very first ever Dora Nomination and Win for a role the playwright himself [Tom Walmsley] specifically asked her to perform. Blood also garnered three nominations for a production Duarte not only starred in but had also produced.

Sandy also performed in Walmsley's classic, Something Red and the World Premiere theatrical debut of Walmsley's The Nun's Vacation, which she had also produced and garnered rave reviews in addition to NOW Magazine’s esteemed "Critics Pick”.

She's thrilled to return to the stage, this time in Los Angeles, and to partner with Barry Papick to create some gold!

"I come across a lot of actors. I’ve met bad ones, good ones and great ones. Everyone from 1st year acting students, to the actor who has no chops, but no one ever tells him; to some of the greats like James Earl Jones, Sean Penn and Glenn Close. I mention Glenn Close in particular, because what she seems like on screen she is not in person. On screen she seems like this 6 foot tall ball crunching beast. In person, Glenn Close is maybe 5 ft2, 5 ft3 at best (even though IMDB says she’s 5 foot 5) and speaks with a tiny voice to strangers and appears a bit detached. Sandy Duarte is the Portuguese Glenn Close. Blood, is certainly not a Vampire story. But it’s got teeth. And it’s coming at you with a mouthful, gnashing away at every fiber of your being in the form of Sandy Duarte. If you want to see a future Dora nominee (Canada’s answer to the Tony Awards) or a future Genie Award nominee (Canada’s answer to the Oscars), look no further than Sandy Duarte" - ReelHeART Blogs  

  • EILEEN DIETZ / Actress

Eileen Dietz is best known for her iconic role as the face of the demon in the The Exorcist aka Captain Howdy, and has worked with exciting and iconic Directors including William Friedkin, Rob Zombie and Tony Perkins.  

Eileen spent much of the late 1960s and early 1970s appearing in theatre productions.

She notably appeared Off-Broadway as the Young Girl in the original Tony winning Steambath directed by the aforementioned Tony Perkins at the Truck and Warehouse Theater in 1970.

 In 1972, she portrayed an androgynous runaway in the premiere of Joyce Carol Oates' Ontological Proof of My Existence. Her portrayal in the play led to an invitation to do a screen test for The Exorcist. She was cast in two memorable roles in the film: Pazuzu the Demon (better known as The Face of Death), and the 'Possessed Regan' (the Linda Blair) and created the most famous and iconic scene for the film. .

Following that was the Emmy-Winning General Hospital where she portrayed Sarah a patient in a mental hospital in Port Charles and also the Emmy-winning Helter-Skelter where she was one of the Manson Gang. 

Eileen has spent most of the last several decades shooting a slew of Independent Films. Her favorites being Queen Of Screams directed by Margo Romero, Lake Alice (just selected by Sundance) and Assholes which won a jury prize at SXSW last year. Her favorite TV roles were Tim and Eric’s Awesome Show and Night Tales directed by Jamie Fox. 

Eileen has also written a book, lauded by critics and fans alike. Exorcising My Demons is a story about dreams, taking great chances, believing in yourself and never looking back. It includes  personal stories regarding her audition and the shoot - many funny, scary and sad, about those dreams and a myriad of choices that led to her role in the scariest movie of all time…

...The Exorcist.

You can find her at many Horror Conventions and Film Festivals across the USA and in Europe: London, Germany and Spain.

We are thrilled to welcome the ultimate scream queen to play the role of Jesse's mother in Ruby's Arms and to bring her talent to the stage once more.

  • JEFF LeBEAU / Actor

"Gary, played in the trilogy’s first iteration by Jeff LeBeau, whose dedication to the role exceeds whatever excellent might be" - On Stage Los Angeles

Emmy Award Winner Jeff LeBeau's work extends from the screen to the stage in a vast array of incredible roles which includes his recent work in the critically lauded Los Angeles production of The Gary Plays, where he played Gary in Parts 1 & 2 of Murray Mednick’s epic 3-part cycle at The Open Fist theatre.

Other highly notable works include Years To The Day, a two person play for which he received an LA Weekly/Stage Raw Best Actor award nomination (Skylight Theatre LA). Plus 59e59th NY, Edinburgh Festival UKOther stage work includes; Conor McPherson’s The Seafarer- SchoolHouse Theatre NY, Burning in China, a solo show Directed by 7-time Oscar Nominee Caleb Deschanel (NY Int’l Fringe, John Drew/Guild Hall, NY); US (Off-Broadway; and Hurlyburly, (Geffen Playhouse).

Jeff’s TV & Film work includes many guest starring roles as well as voicing projects for Dreamworks Animation, Narration for A&E, and the Discovery Channel, and a Short Video Special for which he received an Emmy Award.

Jeff is an alumnus of Cal Arts and a member of The Open Fist, The Road, and Skylight Theatre Companies, as well as Detroit Street films.

We're ecstatic to have Jeff lend his incredibly versatile talent to a role that will prove to be more than meets the eye. 

What your support will do for us!

Your support big or small will make a difference, in helping us bring to light a story the world needs now. A reminder of the delicate nature of life, love and the pursuit of dreams.

Our commonality: A journey on this mortal fleeting thing called life.   

We have carefully curated every detail of this important play to not only be presented beautifully but with integrity and justice for each character, and for the words brought to life by Barry Papick.

As one of our cast members [LeBeau] so eloquently commented: "The dialogue feels like something out of a Tom Waits song". 

Be a part of the journey now and when the curtain rises to expose poetic justice on our Los Angeles stage. 

We Request Your Support 

"I always thought the angels walked with me. I thought they were by my side but now I see I walk alone. So don’t let me embarrass myself. Don’t leave me down here on the floor. Let me help you and you, in return, help me. There are no angels with me tonight. Just you and me alone." - Ruby's Arms

We request your support in helping us achieve our financial goal to support our creative one. 

We need to raise $30,000.

We are actors, love actors and respect actors and with that being said, Ruby's Arms will fall under the Equity umbrella where our actors will be paid respectfully in accordance to Equity standards. We have a cast of seven actors and we're in the process of casting our remaining four roles. A healthy portion of the money will be spent here.

We also wish to launch Ruby's Arms in its rightful stage in Hollywood in which it will run for three-weeks. Money raised will allow us to bring Ruby's Arms from its rehearsal space to the stage. 

A portion of the money raised will also go to our marketing and promotional needs; items such as programs, posters, Public Relations, plus Production needs such as lighting, Stage Manager etc,. and Music Rights.

Need to be enticed? We got Perks!

We have some unique perks that we think you will love!

Give a little and get something fantastic in return. 

Pick something just right for you or a friend!

The Impact

Your contribution will make a difference. 

In a world fuelled by division, art unites us. It reminds us to live. To give. To Love. 

In our small way, we are doing just that.

The power of theatre: To inspire the world one show at a time. 

Our Reputation

BARRY PAPICK / Writer, Director, Producer - is highly esteemed and regarded for his innate talent and his genuine love for acting and story-telling. 
 
With a reputation that speaks for itself, we are happy to tout  his brilliance to convey to you why you should entrust us with your kind donation.
 

"Barry has the tremendous ability to find a fresh and natural authenticity in his performance." - Lawrence Marks/Producer (…Jerry McGuire, Dreamgirls)

"One of the most dedicated and gifted  actors I have worked with. Barry understands the business and the craft--a rare combination!" - Carolyn Richman/Senior VP of Production Columbia Pictures

"I’ve known Barry Papick for years. His commitment to acting and other actors is amazing." - Alec Baldwin/Actor-Director (…Glengary Glenross, The Cooler)

"Barry’s passion for his craft and the joy he brings to his work should be an inspiration for all actors." - Andrew Niccol/Director-Writer (…Simone, Gattaca, The Truman Show)

Barry has been teaching and coaching Actors for 25 years. 

As an Actor, Mr. Papick has been in over 20 Feature Films, 20 stage plays and many episodic television shows including “Swans Crossing,” where he was a series regular. Barry has recently been seen in “Labor Pains” with Lindsey Lohan, “Lake Effects” on The Hallmark Channel and has guest starred on many episodics including Showtimes “Shameless,” Youtube Red’s “Lifeline” and the CBS show “Without A Trace.” He can be seen in Howard Stern’s “Private Parts,” Gus VanSant’s “Finding Forrester” and Andrew Niccol’s “Simone.” He has wrapped the feature film “Rejourer” and the Television pilots “The Monticito Motor Club” for Lifetime and “The Mason Twins” for NBC. He is presently the voice of GNC’s Advertising campaign “Beat Average” and has a Head and Shoulders commercial running with NY Giant Odell Beckum Jr.

SANDY DUARTE / Producer, Actress - May acclaimed Canadian playwright, novelist, poet and screenwriter, Tom Walmlsey,  convince you of her talent and dedication to her art, and everything she discerningly and passionately produces:

"I first saw Sandy Duarte in an independent production of Something Red. She was astounding. Through Sandy’s powerful performance, she somehow re-wrote Elizabeth, turning her into a character much more three dimensional than I’d thought possible. No other actor had managed to bring the role to life since the first production in 1978. I had always blamed the writing, but Sandy overcame any deficiencies of my own. For the first time, I liked the play.

I urged her to act in a production of Blood - it is the best role I've written for a woman and I knew it would give her a chance to stretch her wings. She won the 2011 Dora Mavor Moore Award for Outstanding Female Performance, along with a nomination for Outstanding Production, a nod to her multi-talents in her craft. I've never been happier than I was with her interpretation of the role.

I wrote the leading role in The Nun's Vacation for Sandy and she impressed me once again to such a degree that I am now writing a part in my new play specifically for her.

Sandy is among the best actresses I’ve ever seen and I know that she can do no wrong with anything she touches." - Tom Walmsley

Risks & Challenges

The only risk we face is in not meeting our target goal of 30k in the 60 days this campaign allows.

​We hope you will help us prevent any risk of this. 

With the funds fully raised, we can smoothly go into pre-production by locking down our ideal venue and dates (Spring 2018), and then get the crucial ball rolling for all our steps to be met on our work-back schedule.

Other Ways You Can Help

We respect our friends and colleagues, and with that being said, we know not everyone may be in a position to support monetarily.

So we ask you to please help us in other ways. Such as:

  • Social Sharing and Spreading the Word about our campaign (Help us make some noise)
  • Remember you can use the Indiegogo share tools! It's easy.
  • Have a  great rehearsal space? Want to support our endeavour by letting us rehearse in your space? We're all ears! And our THANK YOU will be heard loud and clear!

Thank You!

We thank you for your time. For reading. Supporting. Spreading the word about Ruby's Arms...

...and embracing us.
story_txt:
Embrace Us! Ruby's Arms at a Glance
Be a part of the magic.
Your contribution will shed light upon the goal we are trying to reach in telling this beautifully compelling story and working with a cast that resonates passion, integrity and true talent. 
10 years in the making, Barry Papick partners with Sandy Duarte to share with the world his story of love, passion and hardship through his juicy words and delicious narrative, stringed through thought-provoking and heart-turning monologues, bounced through characters that will keep you curious long after the curtain drops.
"I figured Hollywood would be this place of dreams. Beauty and dreams. But it wasn’t like that. You couldn’t trust a goddamned soul. I had a boss who constantly tried to fuck me. No, no I mean, you know steal money from my tip jar, beat me out of a couple hours on my check. And an agent who, I think, had his eyes on the perfect body. They all seemed to be stroking you and fucking you at the same time. Sort of the worst kind of lover, the kind you can’t trust. This town is the kind of lover that lies to you with a smile on its face and it’s hand on your dick." - Ruby's Arms
BARRY PAPICK / Writer, Director, Producer

"Barry Papick's ability to communicate the deepest truth makes him an extremely talented and invaluable actor" - Gus VanSant/Director (Good Will Hunting, Finding Forrestor...)
"Barry’s passion for his craft and the joy he brings to his work should be an inspiration for all actors" - Andrew Niccol/Director-Writer (…Simone, Gattaca, The Truman Show)
"To prepare for the role, Gregory says, he had long sessions with acting coach Barry Papick. "He took me very deep inside myself. It got so intense that even he was crying." - Dick Gregory, British GQ
Barry Papick is a highly respected, accomplished actor having been in over 20 Feature Films, 20 stage plays and many episodic television shows including Swans Crossing, where he was a series regular and recently, Shameless. Barry has been seen in Labor Pains with Lindsey Lohan, Lake Effects on The Hallmark Channel and has guest starred on the CBS show Without A Trace. He can be seen in Howard Stern’s Private Parts and Andrew Niccol’s Simone.
One of the top Acting Coaches in the world, Barry has been teaching and coaching Actors for 23 years.
Last year he was the On-set coach for three feature films. Barry has coached for television shows such as The West Wing, The Wire, Malcolm in the Middle, Body of Proof, Brothers and Sisters, Burn Notice, The Originals and many, many more.  Barry has also been the personal On-set coach for Gus VanSant and Adam Sandler's Happy Madison Productions. He has worked with many actors including Sean Connery, Rob Brown, Jamie Foxx, Anna Paquin, Lindsey Lohan, Dennis Quaid, Ione Skye, Sonja Sohn, RZA and Darrin Dewitt Henson (to name a few). 
Barry's undeniable gift as an actor has made him a perfectly rounded creative force as a writer, director and teacher. Under his direction, Ruby's Arms will be an unforgettable experience for the cast and You, the valued audience. 
SANDY DUARTE / Producer, Actress

"Sandy Duarte plays Noelle. Her performance is powerful. She is dominant and controlling. She is a gifted, charismatic and passionate woman" - Mooney on Theatre
"there’s no denying the play’s power, especially when Duarte’s middle-class Elizabeth begins unpacking her own psychological baggage" - Now Toronto
Sandy Duarte is the Winner of the prestigious Dora Mavor Moore Award [Canada's Tony Award] for her Outstanding Female Performance in the iconic production of Blood written by Tom Walmsley. Her very first ever Dora Nomination and Win for a role the playwright himself [Tom Walmsley] specifically asked her to perform. Blood also garnered three nominations for a production Duarte not only starred in but had also produced.
Sandy also performed in Walmsley's classic, Something Red and the World Premiere theatrical debut of Walmsley's The Nun's Vacation, which she had also produced and garnered rave reviews in addition to NOW Magazine’s esteemed "Critics Pick”.
She's thrilled to return to the stage, this time in Los Angeles, and to partner with Barry Papick to create some gold!
"I come across a lot of actors. I’ve met bad ones, good ones and great ones. Everyone from 1st year acting students, to the actor who has no chops, but no one ever tells him; to some of the greats like James Earl Jones, Sean Penn and Glenn Close. I mention Glenn Close in particular, because what she seems like on screen she is not in person. On screen she seems like this 6 foot tall ball crunching beast. In person, Glenn Close is maybe 5 ft2, 5 ft3 at best (even though IMDB says she’s 5 foot 5) and speaks with a tiny voice to strangers and appears a bit detached. Sandy Duarte is the Portuguese Glenn Close. Blood, is certainly not a Vampire story. But it’s got teeth. And it’s coming at you with a mouthful, gnashing away at every fiber of your being in the form of Sandy Duarte. If you want to see a future Dora nominee (Canada’s answer to the Tony Awards) or a future Genie Award nominee (Canada’s answer to the Oscars), look no further than Sandy Duarte" - ReelHeART Blogs  
EILEEN DIETZ / Actress

Eileen Dietz is best known for her iconic role as the face of the demon in the The Exorcist aka Captain Howdy, and has worked with exciting and iconic Directors including William Friedkin, Rob Zombie and Tony Perkins.  
Eileen spent much of the late 1960s and early 1970s appearing in theatre productions.
She notably appeared Off-Broadway as the Young Girl in the original Tony winning Steambath directed by the aforementioned Tony Perkins at the Truck and Warehouse Theater in 1970.
 In 1972, she portrayed an androgynous runaway in the premiere of Joyce Carol Oates' Ontological Proof of My Existence. Her portrayal in the play led to an invitation to do a screen test for The Exorcist. She was cast in two memorable roles in the film: Pazuzu the Demon (better known as The Face of Death), and the 'Possessed Regan' (the Linda Blair) and created the most famous and iconic scene for the film. .
Following that was the Emmy-Winning General Hospital where she portrayed Sarah a patient in a mental hospital in Port Charles and also the Emmy-winning Helter-Skelter where she was one of the Manson Gang. 
Eileen has spent most of the last several decades shooting a slew of Independent Films. Her favorites being Queen Of Screams directed by Margo Romero, Lake Alice (just selected by Sundance) and Assholes which won a jury prize at SXSW last year. Her favorite TV roles were Tim and Eric’s Awesome Show and Night Tales directed by Jamie Fox. 
Eileen has also written a book, lauded by critics and fans alike. Exorcising My Demons is a story about dreams, taking great chances, believing in yourself and never looking back. It includes  personal stories regarding her audition and the shoot - many funny, scary and sad, about those dreams and a myriad of choices that led to her role in the scariest movie of all time…
...The Exorcist.
You can find her at many Horror Conventions and Film Festivals across the USA and in Europe: London, Germany and Spain.
We are thrilled to welcome the ultimate scream queen to play the role of Jesse's mother in Ruby's Arms and to bring her talent to the stage once more.
JEFF LeBEAU / Actor

"Gary, played in the trilogy’s first iteration by Jeff LeBeau, whose dedication to the role exceeds whatever excellent might be" - On Stage Los Angeles
Emmy Award Winner Jeff LeBeau's work extends from the screen to the stage in a vast array of incredible roles which includes his recent work in the critically lauded Los Angeles production of The Gary Plays, where he played Gary in Parts 1 & 2 of Murray Mednick’s epic 3-part cycle at The Open Fist theatre.
Other highly notable works include Years To The Day, a two person play for which he received an LA Weekly/Stage Raw Best Actor award nomination (Skylight Theatre LA). Plus 59e59th NY, Edinburgh Festival UKOther stage work includes; Conor McPherson’s The Seafarer- SchoolHouse Theatre NY, Burning in China, a solo show Directed by 7-time Oscar Nominee Caleb Deschanel (NY Int’l Fringe, John Drew/Guild Hall, NY); US (Off-Broadway; and Hurlyburly, (Geffen Playhouse).
Jeff’s TV & Film work includes many guest starring roles as well as voicing projects for Dreamworks Animation, Narration for A&E, and the Discovery Channel, and a Short Video Special for which he received an Emmy Award.
Jeff is an alumnus of Cal Arts and a member of The Open Fist, The Road, and Skylight Theatre Companies, as well as Detroit Street films.
We're ecstatic to have Jeff lend his incredibly versatile talent to a role that will prove to be more than meets the eye. 
What your support will do for us!
Your support big or small will make a difference, in helping us bring to light a story the world needs now. A reminder of the delicate nature of life, love and the pursuit of dreams.
Our commonality: A journey on this mortal fleeting thing called life.   
We have carefully curated every detail of this important play to not only be presented beautifully but with integrity and justice for each character, and for the words brought to life by Barry Papick.
As one of our cast members [LeBeau] so eloquently commented: "The dialogue feels like something out of a Tom Waits song". 
Be a part of the journey now and when the curtain rises to expose poetic justice on our Los Angeles stage. 

We Request Your Support 
"I always thought the angels walked with me. I thought they were by my side but now I see I walk alone. So don’t let me embarrass myself. Don’t leave me down here on the floor. Let me help you and you, in return, help me. There are no angels with me tonight. Just you and me alone." - Ruby's Arms
We request your support in helping us achieve our financial goal to support our creative one. 
We need to raise $30,000.
We are actors, love actors and respect actors and with that being said, Ruby's Arms will fall under the Equity umbrella where our actors will be paid respectfully in accordance to Equity standards. We have a cast of seven actors and we're in the process of casting our remaining four roles. A healthy portion of the money will be spent here.
We also wish to launch Ruby's Arms in its rightful stage in Hollywood in which it will run for three-weeks. Money raised will allow us to bring Ruby's Arms from its rehearsal space to the stage. 
A portion of the money raised will also go to our marketing and promotional needs; items such as programs, posters, Public Relations, plus Production needs such as lighting, Stage Manager etc,. and Music Rights.
Need to be enticed? We got Perks!
We have some unique perks that we think you will love!
Give a little and get something fantastic in return. 
Pick something just right for you or a friend!
The Impact

Your contribution will make a difference. 
In a world fuelled by division, art unites us. It reminds us to live. To give. To Love. 
In our small way, we are doing just that.
The power of theatre: To inspire the world one show at a time.

BARRY PAPICK / Writer, Director, Producer - is highly esteemed and regarded for his innate talent and his genuine love for acting and story-telling.

story:
Short Summary

We're a collective of established theatre artists working under the name Below the Salt Theatre. Directed by Ken Schwartz, the stellar award-winning cast includes Jackie Torrens as Hamlet, Stephanie MacDonald as Queen Gertrude, Christian Murray as Rosencrantz & Guildenstern, Andrea Lee Norwood as Laertes, Marty Burt as Claudius and Micha Cromwell as Horatio. 

What We Need & What You Get

We've worked really hard for the last 2 years, raising money for this unique production of Hamlet. We've been fortunate to receive Canada Council and Arts NS money but we still need 8500.00 to help us stage this production the way we envision it. Funds raised will help us cover show expenses such as costumes, specialty props & set pieces, design & box office personnel.

But we need you! And we're willing to send you rewards for your help - please check out our Perks! We can also issue you tax receipts through Theatre Nova Scotia, our provincial organization that serves  professional theatre in Nova Scotia. 

FAQs about Our Campaign:

Can I get a tax receipt?

Yes! If you claim a reward, you can get a partial tax receipt. If you don't claim a reward, you can get a full tax receipt. We will need your full address, name and contact information in order to provide this. Theatre Nova Scotia will be issuing the receipt.

When can I get my rewards? 

We will be sending out rewards in April 2018. In the case of donors purchasing the private show, we will be in contact long before this to arrange dates for end of April 2018.

What if I don't want a reward, I just want to give you some money?

That's no problem. Just click on the "Back It" button, add the amount and select "No Reward"

Can I increase my donation, once it's been made?

Yes! Just send a quick note to us at HalifaxHamlet@gmail.com and we'll take care of this on our end.

Can I give someone else my reward? 

Yes, O Saintly One! For billing purposes, make the donation in your name but send us a quick note at HalifaxHamlet@gmail.com letting us know who you would like to receive your reward and we'll take care of it!

What happens if for some reason the project does not occur?

In the unlikely event the project does not take place, we will provide full refunds.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute right now? No problem - we would love it if you just spread the word!
Follow us on social media, post about this to your friends. Leave comments on our Facebook page Below the Salt's Hamlet and our Twitter @HalifaxHamlet.

story:
Who We Are

A group of multicultural women actors who have come together to present an original play that challenges Hollywood expectations & stereotypes. Written by actor and playwright, Ma Troggian, this piece was first workshopped in May 2017 through a space grant at The Stella Adler Studio of Acting. With your help we can be a successful part of the Playwrights Showcase series at Manhattan Repertory Theatre Company in October. Tania Kass directed both productions. The roles were originated and are played by:

Ma Troggian as JOANNE
Ashley Krysinski as MELANIE
Suzie Léger as GRETA
Fruzsina Nagy as SAFIRA
Selamawit Worku as TAMI
Barbara Eliodorio as CLARISSA

In conjunction with The Manhattan Repertory Theatre, the following individuals serve as producers of this show run:  Selamawit Worku, Kenneth Shook, Ma Troggian, and Tania Kass.

What is the Play About?

What happens when a traumatized Brunette decides to become part of a Blondes Only Marilyn Monroe Obsessed acting community?

This 30-minute satire reflects on Hollywood stereotypes and expectations thrown at women. A group of women set in modern-day Los Angeles, the play follows one woman's journey in joining an “acting" community and how she develops her identity amidst all of the influences and pressures surrounding her. The play was submitted and accepted in the Playwrights' Showcase Series at the Manhattan Repertory Theatre.

Performance Dates are Friday October 6th and Saturday October 7th at 6:30pm

Ticket Information: http://manhattanrep.com/playwrights-showcase-se...

 

WHAT WE NEED

GOAL: $2,100

  • Production Costs (wardrobe, props) : $200
  • Creative Services (talent, marketing/promotional materials, participation fees) : $1,900

PERKS!

  • $10 - Personalized E-card 
  • $30 - Personalized Video Message
  • $50 -  Signed Poster from the Cast + Creative Team
  • $100 - Marilyn Monroe Song sang to you
  • $200 - Thank you Video Message, Signed Poster from the Cast/Creative Team and a Marilyn Monroe song sang to you

Why We Need Your Help

You help make this play happen! Now that we have been selected for the showcase we have use of their theatre space, technical support and access to their established patrons/members. However, we do not receive any revenue from the ticket sales.

You, our friends, family, and peers can support independent theater today. You know the amount of labor that goes into a production. Weeks and hours rehearsing in studios, houses, parks, etc.. Investing time and money day in and day out to share stories with you that are important, thought-provoking, and fun. 

Please help us to cover the costs of our independent project and make Norma Jean was a Brunette a success! Now is your chance to support independent artists who dedicate their lives to making engaging art.   

 

Other Ways You Can Help

So you can’t give $10? It happens unfortunately. BUT, you can still support our project:

  • Please tell everyone in your life! Spread the word to your friends, family, and co-workers everywhere in NYC (or internationally!). The arts is international and about community... if you love our mission and story, then we hope other people in your life will too. Please share with them our project and ask if they will donate and share our campaign in some way.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools below (tweet, post on facebook and instagram)! One post today from you, can help us reach our goal tomorrow.

Thank you for all of your support!

story:
Our Story...

Tyler, Tiffany, and I met nearly two years ago while taking a course at Stella Adler.  It was an in depth ten week scene study class under the guidance of Paul Takacs.  After the first few weeks, a friendship and mutual respect of each others' work began to develop.

Although the course was finished, our relationships, both professional and personal, continued to blossom.   With Paul's help and direction, the three of us left the class with a new found confidence in our abilities, and a determination to elevate the quality of our work onstage.  

The closer we became, and the more we discussed our artistic goals, we found we all shared the same passion to create our own work, and the drive to forge our own opportunities.  Thus, Ground Light Theatre was born!

Through the production process, we have quickly learned the ins and outs of producing a show in New York City.  From obtaining rights to the extensive NYC fire codes, each step carries a cost.

We started this venture not with intention to make money, but to create a quality and meaningful theatrical experience, for this production and all those to follow.  Not just for ourselves, but for everyone involved in the process.  From the set designer to the audience.

We ask your help in bringing this first project (the first of many) to fruition.  Thank you all in advance for any contributions, and we look forward to seeing you all on opening night!


Tiffany, Tyler, and Mike

story:
Robert Frosty Theatre Company is a Chicago-based sketch comedy stage combat...let's say collective because that's hip and trendy.

Born of rage and forged in the crucible of millennial nihilism, our...collective...seeks to tell the greatest untold stories of American folklore through the illusion of stage violence - from poet Robert Frost's chance encounter with Satan all the way to the odyssey surrounding the ancient and primordial magic of Guns'N'Roses legend, Slash. Formed by pseudo-historians Scott Myers and Luke Van Marter in the summer of 2014, RFTC has been slicing and dicing theatre in Chicago ever since. 

Our first year at Elgin Fringe Festival was in 2016, when we brought our original, whimsical time-traveling indictment of American capitalism, aptly titled, "Capitali$m! A Cabaret Through Time and Space."

Our second year at Elgin Fringe Festival was in 2017, when we brought our original, whimsical, time-traveling indictment of the 7th President of the United States, Andrew Jackson, aptly titled, "Andrew Jackson: An American Maniac."

THIS YEAR, our third year at Elgin Fringe Festival, we will bring an original whimsical, time-traveling indictment of the Marvel Cinematic Universe and Avengers franchise, aptly titled, "Frostvengers: Insanity War."

Why we need your Starbucks money:
Traveling to another city with as many props and costumes and weapons as we have gets a little pricey. Staying overnight in another city in order to bring the glorious citizens there 4 high-octane performances of the absurdity we do best gets even pricier. Factor in rehearsal rental for those rainy days we can't just fight in the park, paying our actors and director a fair price for their expertise, and, oh yeah, the festival fees themselves... Let's just say we could use your help a little more than Starbucks could!

AND WE'LL REPAY YOU IN PERKS AND GOOD KARMA!

You want a sticker? WE GOT STICKERS.
You want tickets to both this AND our annual Christmas extraVENGEANCEanza? WE GOT TICKETS.
You want our head writer Luke Van Marter to write your obituary for you? HE HAS AGREED TO DO SO AND CANNOT BACK OUT NOW OR TORI WILL TAKE HIS CUBS HAT AWAY FROM HIM.

We are even prepared to send RFTC Director of Public Relations, Mr. Doug Fudge, to a location of your choosing, to create the ultimate diversion or spectacle, for the low-low price of...our entire goal!

The Impact

With your support, you can help a group of intrepid young actors put their bachelor's degrees to good use and put on a kick-ass show for the loving people of Elgin and any Chicagoans who are willing to make the commute. 

All we've ever wanted is to make people forget that death is everywhere by telling jokes....and also by presenting a shit-ton of death on stage. ....but in a really funny way.

I quote the great Chris Jerico when I say, "the world may never ever EVVVVVVVVVVER be the same aGAIN."
 

Even if you cannot donate...
Please share this campaign with your friends and enemies!
Follow us on Facebook and Instagram! 
Come see us perform at Elgin Fringe Festival 2018!

story:
Andrea Peña & Artists' NEW CREATION!

5 dancers | 1 opera signer |  1 live DJ |  1 lighting designer | 2 costume designers

We are looking to raise $10,000 before our travel departure Dec 2nd 2018 to the Banff Arts Center for an intensive creative residency. The amount collected will cover expenses for airline tickets and the artists' fees involved in the project. With your support, we will have the opportunity to participate in one of the most renowned artistic residencies in Canada. 

After a creative residency with prestigious international presenters DanseDanse, 6.58 (New creation) will be entering its final stages towards a final production ready for touring and stage. Canada's renowned Banff Arts Centre has invited AP&A into their creative studios to finalize the creation of this wild performative universe. This is the first time the company is embarking on such a vast creation with a large set of creatively diverse disciplines and artists. 

We plan on making something avant garde, multi-disciplinary, futuristic, honest, human and surreal. BUT we can't tell you any more than that, because it's gotta be a surprise for when you see it live. Trust us.

_____________________

WHO ARE WE (AP&A)

Andrea Peña & Artists is a Montreal based contemporary dance company known for their vigorous engagement between the physical body and the conscious individual self. Andrea Peña has collaborated with celebrated performers, visual artists and filmmakers in Canada, Europe, and the United States. Peña and her company, have been recognized with numerous awards and commissions, for their visceral and highly rigorous creations, including a recent award at the Hong Kong International Choreography Festival for best choreography. Andrea Peña & Artists tours extensively around the world to Asia, Latin America, Europe, and Canada with productions that include UNTITLED I (2018), ZERO UNO UNO ZERO (2017),  KAIROS (2015), and VIUN (2014). The company focuses on developing alternative multi-disciplinary universes that rupture out notions of a sensible humanity, transformed as large ensemble installations that are experienced viscerally by the spectator. Difficult choreography that is highly intricate, vulnerable and raw, extending beyond mere movement.

"Peña holds a surprising and unpredictable artistic signature that reveals a new female discourse of contemporary... a language and a universe of astounding intelligence, and the shaping of an unusual and unique atmosphere. The truth of this choreographer and the world that follows breathes a beautiful large force of human consciousness."

~ Mellissa Larivière, Director of Festival Zone Homa

_______________________

UPCOMING PROJECTS

The company will be continuing the development of the creation 2018-2019, with an exciting technical residency in Gaspe, QC with presenter CD Spectacles, to complete the full universe of this creation. 

October 26th 2018 | La Foire @ MAI | Montreal, QC

Nov 12th & 15th 2018 | OFF CINARS Performances | Montreal, QC

Dec 2nd -14th 2018 | Banff Arts Center Dance Residency  | Banff, AB

August 17th- 30th 2019 | CD Spectacles Technical Residency | Gaspe, QC

Season 2019-2020 | Eastern Quebec Tour | CD Spectacles | Gaspe, QC

_______________________

Your Impact on our Creative Dreams!

OUR GOAL = $10,000

We welcome contributions of any size – big or small, every gift will bring us closer to achieving our goal.  For a gift $25 or more you have the option to receive one of the special perks listed on this page – from personalized shout-outs to exclusive packages that include: photos, signed scripts, a personalized video thank-you, an invitation to a private studio rehearsal, and even live streaming of our rehearsals! 

    _______________________

    Other Ways You Can Help!

    SHARE

    Spreading the word is another valuable way you can help Andrea Peña & Artists. Share this campaign on Facebook and Twitter. Email it to your friends! 

    #AP&A | Facebook | Instagram

    ____

     

    (FR)

    Andrea Peña & Artists NOUVELLE CRÉATION au Banff Arts Centre

    5 danseurs | 1 chanteuse d’opéra | 1 DJ en direct | 1 concepteur d’éclairage | 2 costumes designers

    Nous souhaitons collecter 10 000 $ avant notre départ, le 2 décembre 2018, au Banff Arts Centre pour une résidence de création magique. Le montant collecté couvrira les frais de billets d’avion et les frais d’artistes impliqués dans le projet. Avec votre soutien, nous aurons l’occasion de participer à l’une des résidences artistiques les plus réputées au Canada.

    Après une résidence créative avec les prestigieux présentateurs internationaux DanseDanse, 6.58 (nouvelle création) entrera dans ses dernières étapes de transformation pour passer à la production finale, prête pour la tournée et la scène. Le célèbre Banff Arts Centre du Canada a invité AP&A dans ses studios de création pour finaliser la création de cet univers performatif sauvage. C’est la première fois que la société se lance dans une création d’une telle envergure avec un large éventail de disciplines et d’artistes créatifs divers.

    Nous prévoyons de faire quelque chose d’avant-gardiste, multidisciplinaire, futuriste, honnête, humain et surréel. MAIS nous ne pouvons pas vous en dire plus, parce que ça doit vous surprendre quand vous le voyez en direct. Faites-nous confiance!

    Contribuez à la création multimédia créée par l’une des meilleures compagnies de danse contemporaine montréalaise

    Andrea Peña & Artists se lance dans une nouvelle création multidisciplinaire et nous avons besoin de votre soutien pour participer au prestigieux BANFF ARTS CENTER. La compagnie a été sélectionnée pour participer à sa résidence artistique pendant deux semaines et avec votre aide nous pourrons faire en sorte que ce nouveau travail prenne vie.

    _________________________________________________

    QUI SOMMES-NOUS (AP&A)

    Andrea Peña & Artists est une compagnie de danse contemporaine basée à Montréal reconnue pour son engagement vigoureux entre le corps physique et le moi conscient. Andrea Peña a collaboré avec des interprètes, des artistes visuels et des cinéastes de renom au Canada, en Europe et aux États-Unis. Peña et sa compagnie ont été récompensés par de nombreuses récompenses et commandes pour leurs créations viscérales et extrêmement rigoureuses, dont un récent prix au Festival international de chorégraphie de Hong Kong pour la meilleure chorégraphie. Andrea Peña & Artists effectue de nombreuses tournées à travers le monde en Asie, en Amérique latine, en Europe et au Canada, notamment avec UNTITLED I (2018), ZERO UNO UNO ZERO (2017), KAIROS (2015) et VIUN (2014). L’organisme se concentre sur le développement d’univers multidisciplinaires alternatifs qui brisent les notions d’humanité sensible transformées en grandes installations d’ensemble vécues viscéralement par le spectateur. Une chorégraphie difficile, extrêmement complexe, vulnérable et crue, qui dépasse le simple mouvement.

    « Peña possède une signature artistique surprenante et imprévisible qui révèle un nouveau discours féminin contemporain... un langage et un univers d’intelligence étonnante, ainsi que la formation d’une atmosphère inhabituelle et unique. La vérité de cette chorégraphe et du monde qui suit respire une belle grande force de conscience humaine ».

    ~ Mellissa Larivière, directrice du Festival Zone Homa

    __________________

    PROJETS À VENIR

    L’organisme poursuivra le développement de la création 2018-2019, avec une résidence technique passionnante à Gaspé, au Québec, avec le présentateur CD Spectacles, afin de compléter l’univers complet de cette création.

    26 octobre 2018​ | La Foire @ MAI | Montréal, QC

    12 et 15 novembre 2018  | OFF CINARS Performances | Montréal, QC

    17-30 août 2019 | Banff Arts Center Dance Residency  | Banff, AB

    August 17th- 30th 2019 | CD Spectacles Technical Residency | Gaspé, QC

    Saison 2019-2020 |  CD Spectacles | Gaspé, QC

    ___________________

    Votre impact sur nos rêves créatifs!

    NOTRE OBJECTIF = 10 000 $

    Nous acceptons des contributions de toutes tailles — grand ou petit, chaque don nous rapprochera de la réalisation de notre objectif. Pour un cadeau de 25 $ ou plus, vous avez la possibilité de recevoir l’un des avantages spéciaux énumérés sur cette page — des shout-outs personnalisés aux forfaits exclusifs comprenant : photos, scripts signés, une vidéo personnalisée, une invitation à un événement privé, répétition en studio, et même un streaming en direct de nos répétitions!

    ___________________

    D’autres façons que vous pouvez nous aider!

    PARTAGER

    Faire passer le message est un autre moyen précieux d’aider Andrea Peña & Artists. Partagez cette campagne sur votre profil Facebook et Twitter. Envoyez-le à vos amis!

    #AP&A | Facebook | Instagram

story:
Here and Queer! 

Here, Queer, and Mentally Unclear is being co-produced by Izzy Joan and Bradley Birkholz.

Izzy Joan is a performer, singer, producer, and actor who is diagnosed with bipolar disorder and who identifies as bisexual. She created and performed in the original adaptation of this piece titled 'Bi/Bi/Baby', in which she explored the relationship between her mental health and sexuality. Eventually she decided to open up the project to the entire LGBTQ+ community, and that's where Here, Queer, and Mentally Unclear was born! 

Bradley Birkholz is an LGBTQ+ YouTuber, activist, and performer who was recently named as one of Wales most influential LGBT+ persons on the 2018 Pinc List. He's also a drag artist by the name of Bella Tempus, and he's passionate about facilitating discussions in the LGBTQ+ community that aren't being held elsewhere. He also frequently discusses his battles with anxiety on his channel, as well as LGBT+ issues. 

Here, Queer, and Mentally Unclear attempts to do something that has seldom been done before. It seeks to bring light to the mental health struggles unique to the LGBTQ+ community, reduce stigma, educate, and simultaneously entertain. Mental health is truly not discussed enough in society, and especially the immense struggles we face in the LGBTQ+ community with mental health -- and with your help that message could get out to a wider audience and have a bigger impact. 

The Money Stuff

It's really important to us to be fully transparent in this project. This is a collaborative effort to make a mark on society -- and we want you to be as involved in that process as possible. Unfortunately, we can't do it on our own -- so here's the breakdown of where your support would go: 

  • We're currently seeking roughly £5,000 in total.
  • This would go to paying performers, paying for travel and accommodation for the team, as well as paying for equipment and any other necessities. We sincerely believe that everyone should get paid for the work that they do as artists, and with a higher budget we could ensure more diversity with our performers and a bigger team, rather than having to essentially put this entire show on ourselves. 
  • If we don't make our goal, the show will still be extremely limited to the scope, number of performers, diversity, longevity, and over all impact of the project. 

Let's Make a Difference Together

We would love to take this project much farther than the two scheduled performances we have right now. Some of our long term goals include: 

  • Turning the production into a national or even global educational theatre tour. 
  • Transforming the production into a short film or even web-series focused on balancing education with entertainment. 
  • Creating a compelling social media campaign of awareness for the dangers of mental illness in the LGBTQ+ community, where support can be found, and what we can do as a society to make meaningful change. 

Right now our biggest limitation is, truly, funding. We have the drive to make these dreams a reality, but both Izzy and Bradley have day jobs they have to work to pay the bills and rent. If we could get enough funding we could commit fully to this project and the impact it could have.

Get Involved In Other Ways! 

We know that not everyone can afford to help, and we would love to still have you involved in this movement! Here's how you can get involved: 

  • Share this campaign on your social media, and encourage those around you to donate. 
  • Get involved on social media, tweet us, make posts about the production, share our social media posts, and just generally make a lot of noise surrounding LGBT+ mental health! 
  • If you're a performer, marketer, director, or anything else and have something you could offer us, whether in skills, equipment, et al, please don't hesitate to get in touch (hereandqueerproductions@gmail.com)! 

Thanks for reading! We're excited to involve you in this journey and make Here, Queer, and Mentally Unclear as impactful as possible!

Izzy Joan is a performer, singer, producer, and actor who is diagnosed with bipolar disorder and who identifies as bisexual. She created and performed in the original adaptation of this piece titled 'Bi/Bi/Baby', in which she explored the relationship between her mental health and sexuality. Eventually she decided to open up the project to the entire LGBTQ+ community, and that's where Here, Queer, and Mentally Unclear was born! 
Bradley Birkholz is an LGBTQ+ YouTuber, activist, and performer who was recently named as one of Wales most influential LGBT+ persons on the 2018 Pinc List. He's also a drag artist by the name of Bella Tempus, and he's passionate about facilitating discussions in the LGBTQ+ community that aren't being held elsewhere. He also frequently discusses his battles with anxiety on his channel, as well as LGBT+ issues. 

Here, Queer, and Mentally Unclear attempts to do something that has seldom been done before. It seeks to bring light to the mental health struggles unique to the LGBTQ+ community, reduce stigma, educate, and simultaneously entertain. Mental health is truly not discussed enough in society, and especially the immense struggles we face in the LGBTQ+ community with mental health -- and with your help that message could get out to a wider audience and have a bigger impact. 

The Money Stuff
It's really important to us to be fully transparent in this project. This is a collaborative effort to make a mark on society -- and we want you to be as involved in that process as possible. Unfortunately, we can't do it on our own -- so here's the breakdown of where your support would go: 

We're currently seeking roughly £5,000 in total.
This would go to paying performers, paying for travel and accommodation for the team, as well as paying for equipment and any other necessities. We sincerely believe that everyone should get paid for the work that they do as artists, and with a higher budget we could ensure more diversity with our performers and a bigger team, rather than having to essentially put this entire show on ourselves. 
If we don't make our goal, the show will still be extremely limited to the scope, number of performers, diversity, longevity, and over all impact of the project. 


Let's Make a Difference Together
We would love to take this project much farther than the two scheduled performances we have right now. Some of our long term goals include: 

Turning the production into a national or even global educational theatre tour. 
Transforming the production into a short film or even web-series focused on balancing education with entertainment. 
Creating a compelling social media campaign of awareness for the dangers of mental illness in the LGBTQ+ community, where support can be found, and what we can do as a society to make meaningful change. 

Right now our biggest limitation is, truly, funding. We have the drive to make these dreams a reality, but both Izzy and Bradley have day jobs they have to work to pay the bills and rent. If we could get enough funding we could commit fully to this project and the impact it could have.
Get Involved In Other Ways! 
We know that not everyone can afford to help, and we would love to still have you involved in this movement! Here's how you can get involved: 

Share this campaign on your social media, and encourage those around you to donate. 
Get involved on social media, tweet us, make posts about the production, share our social media posts, and just generally make a lot of noise surrounding LGBT+ mental health! 
If you're a performer, marketer, director, or anything else and have something you could offer us, whether in skills, equipment, et al, please don't hesitate to get in touch (hereandqueerproductions@gmail.com)! 

Thanks for reading! We're excited to involve you in this journey and make Here, Queer, and Mentally Unclear as impactful as possible!

story:
Burning Man 2017: our gift will be a series of interactive workshops, rehearsals, and playa performances.

We invite the passersby to perform with us.  We meet around artworks and fire.  We play with language, the written word, and our bodies. We have fun.

Here’s what we offer:

  • The Tarot Bar - A fine cocktail can be earned by selecting  your Major Arcana - Shakespearean archetype. 
  • Open Rehearsals & Workshops  -  We share voice, body, tips and techniques.
  • Performances - We’ll share new and old work on our stage and around the city.

Please support us in this passionate practice of theater.

Your contribution will:

  1. Add trussing and rigging components 
  2. Strengthen our stage, bar and balcony
  3. Create a backdrop and shade structure inspired by the Globe Theatre in London.
  4. Design lighting for nighttime performances.
  5. Develop and design playa performances 

Would you like to participate? Know of others who might like work too?  Please pass the word!

Find us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/BurningGlobePublic.

story:
About us and the project...

pluck. make theatre.  They make slick, exciting, ruddy good theatre, because they got tired of waiting for other people to do it for them and tired of waiting for the phone to ring. ​

They decided to take matters into their own hands. To stop making excuses and start making work. So one plucky actress rang one plucky actor, and pluck. was formed.  

To date, pluck. have produced four full-scale shows and numerous new writing nights. Their most recent project was BIRTHDAY SUIT by David K. Barnes, which had a critically acclaimed run at the Old Red Lion in 2017 and was nominated for three OFFIE awards including Best New Play. 

Alkaline is our biggest, most ambitious and most topical production to date. It's a complex and provocative play from an exciting talent. It poses difficult questions, challenges audience's preconceptions and allegiances, and introduces the world to five brand new and remarkable characters.

'People love being in control, don't you think? But you can't control something you don't understand.' 

Sophie and Sarah have been best friends forever. Sophie is newly engaged to her fiancé Nick and wants to celebrate. Sarah also has a new fiancé, Ali, and some more big news – she has recently converted to Islam.

One hot summer evening the two couples have a get together. Sophie is desperate to meet Ali and even more desperate to rescue her drifting friendship with Sarah. Sophie also wants to ask Sarah if she’ll take off her hijab for Sophie’s wedding - a headscarf ‘just won’t quite go’ with the other bridesmaids, and Sophie likes things to match. It’s all going well (ish) until an uninvited guest arrives with some news that turns the evening – and the couples’ lives - upside down.

What we need & what will that do?

With each production we have mounted, we have endeavoured to raise the stakes and the production values. In just four years, in this notoriously competitive, cut-throat and underfunded industry, we are now bringing a show to a venue with a profile and prestige that we could never have dreamed of back in 2014. 

But with this ambitious new platform and level of exposure and ambition come ever-increasing costs. The list of necessary line items in the budget is quite frankly terrifying, and includes (but is by no means limited to): actors' fees, creative team fees, venue hire costs, rehearsal space costs, set construction materials and build costs, props and costumes, equipment hire, the design and printing of promotional materials, a marketing campaign, a PR representative, online advertising - the list goes on.  

To help cover all of the above and more, we are looking for your help to reach our funding goal of £5,000 - which is still only a small percentage of our overall production cost. 

The Impact

Alkaline hopes to speak to a community on the doorstep of the theatre that have not always seen themselves represented on their local stage. The piece aims to disrupt stereotypes, challenge audience's preconceptions and turn their normal allegiances on their head, holding a mirror up to self-professed liberalism to interrogate whether it sometimes only goes skin deep. 

Our track record of darkly comic plays is proven. Our previous production of BIRTHDAY SUIT was a huge success, playing to packed houses and great critical reception - and three OFFIE nominations! 

The impact of bringing Alkaline to the London stage will filter down to a younger generation of theatre makers, too. We started as two friends with a dream in a beer garden four years ago, and now we are here (and still sometimes in beer gardens). With each period of pluck's growth, we look to other production companies and theatre makers for inspiration and guidance. And in turn, we have seen numerous young graduates and actors who want to take the leap into producing seek us out for advice, which is a fantastic way to foster young talent. We like to think that we are proof that sometimes you can make your own luck - with lots of hard work and determination! 

Risks & Challenges

This isn't our first time at the rodeo and, of course, we have weathered many a storm to be where we are today. We've lost out on pitches, been denied numerous funding applications, venues have broken equipment that we'd secured use of as a favour, a key item of set once didn't arrive before press night - we have faced every possible logistical and creative challenge along the way in a production process. We've had to become pretty good at innovative and spontaneous problem-solving! All the knowledge we have gained in this field is through hard-won experience. 

There's absolutely nothing unnecessary in our hefty production budget, and we are responsible for being able to honour the financial commitments we have made to everyone involved, which is no small obligation, and one that we take very seriously. Many projects even at this level would still be profit-share, as so many London theatre companies working on the fringe still seem to treat actors as the least important piece of the puzzle. We are paying everyone involved at every level for their time and their talent, and that is something that we are very proud of.

Other Ways You Can Help

You may not be able to contribute to our fund here and that's fine; there's loads of other ways you can help....

Buying a ticket (or two) to see what all the fuss is about is a good start. You can book easily through the Park Theatre website here; https://www.parktheatre.co.uk/whats-on/alkaline

Wait, there's more! We'd be thrilled if you could share the news about Alkaline. We'll be making some special announcements about our cast and performances that are audio described and specifically for parents and babies. Check us out on Twitter and Instagram and help us spread the word. 

Twitter: @PLUCKtheatre

Instagram: pluck.theatre

From the bottom of our hearts, thank you - and we hope to see you at the show!

Twitter: @PLUCKtheatre
Instagram: pluck.theatre
