story:
Short Summary

Between Us Productions is, at it's heart, just a couple of local girls, trying to make theatre that is real and socially relevant. The writer, the actor and every other theatre artist is needed now more than ever to reflect the difficult and challenging choices we make in today's world. 

We are thrilled to be able to work with Gary Jaffe on Diaspora, a story of two women, their identities and the messiness that comes with having to reject something in order to embrace something else that feels true to you. 

Theatre is, however, expensive. Performance spaces, costumes and lighting cost thousands and thousands of dollars and that doesn't take into account our family of artists donating their time and expertise for free. We want this story to be told on the professional level as it deserves, and we know that with help from you we can do that, as we have done in the past. Every little bit you can give helps these diverse, personal stories shine a little brighter and makes you, yourself a part of the production in a very real sense. 

Diaspora, TX

Written by Gary Jaffe
Directed by Samantha Lee Manas

Cast List

Danielle Hinojosa - Sarah Villegas

Ariana Hinojosa - Priscilla Diaz

Rachel Shapiro-Hinojosa & Rabbi Libbe - Lisa Dennett

Brandon & Gael - Jacques Leon

Marisa - Samantha Talbott

Jesus Hinojosa - Guy Wellman

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are asking for 3000 dollars. This will pay for the performance space and help pay for costumes, lights, rehearsal and audition costs, as well as pay for any Equity actors. 
  • Our perks will include everything from a  Facebook shout out to a full season pass for you and a guest, which includes this and other upcoming productions. 

The Impact

  • Identity is a complex subject and one that requires rigorous art, such as this one.
  • Our past funded productions, such as Uprising and Detainee, have been well received and successful, forging conversations about such timely topics as torture and union organization. 
  • We already have most of the cast set, and we can't wait to share more about the process to get you as excited as you are. 

Risks & Challenges

Theatre is expensive and time consuming. It is even more challenging to do original work that doesn't foster recognition in the eyes of a potential audience. 

  • We have years of experience creating beautiful, truthful productions on a low budget.
  • We plan to continue our mission of marketing these productions to new audiences as best we can provide our artists with the exposure they deserve.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Every little bit helps, but whether you can donate or not, please tweet, post and tell your friends about this project! We really want to get this out to a wider audience and we can't do it without you.

story:
Towards Vivencia (TWV) is an online community, launched 2 years ago in order to provide artists with high-quality and accessible training.

In response to the global pandemic, we acted immediately to offer a wide variety of weekly classes. Since March, we have offered a consistent and varied programme of online classes, workshops, seminars and even a summer intensive, seeing over 7000 people come through our digital doors. 

 

We are already a strong community, but now, we need a home. A place that takes us to the next level of accessibility, consistency and connection. A home that we can build together.

Introducing the Towards Vivencia Academy, an online platform where a diverse programme of high-quality classes, workshops, seminars, festivals and more are all integrated into one, easy-to-use, web site.

 

  • A busy freelancer, with no time or money to commute to your next class
  • Working 3 different jobs and can only spare 1hr of your day to dance
 

 

  • Want to have access to the most specialised knowledge: Tai chi, dance for film, or Feldenkrais, but don’t have access to the people who will train you
 
  • Someone who lives in the middle of nowhere and it is rare that someone comes to lead a workshop around your area
  • Dying to work with a particular artist but have no way to meet them, let alone take class with them

The Towards Vivencia Academy can become your home for training and community.

TWV Academy offers the opportunity to attend highly specialised seminars and train with most amazing teachers from all over the world, all from the comfort of your own living room, kitchen, back garden and more. The programme will be curated to reflect both the values of TWV and Jorge Crecis’ methodology to expand consciousness through peak performance presence. This platform seeks to bridge the gap between our online classes community and those participating in our 1-year signature presence training programme, enabling the best of both worlds to inspire each other.

 

We need to build it together

The TWV Academy is going to be your home, therefore, you play an active role in building it. This platform will operate like a collective, one where the members have the opportunity to:  

  • Receive early-bird information regarding upcoming classes, workshops, and opportunities to enrol in our year-long Online Presence Training Programme first
  • Join the curation team and decide the next term’s teachers.
  • Decide which workshops or festivals TWV could offer and/or collaborate with
  • Take as many classes as you want

Above all else, by actively participating in the TWV Academy, especially at this early stage, you are making this new home a reality. You have the opportunity to create the home that you need, take control of your continuous professional and personal development by being part of the community who make those decision for the community.

You will make the world a bit smaller.

This is a home we are building together. Therefore, it is important for us to share our initial blueprints for this home with you, how we will be following them and what will be the impact of our efforts.

This is the timeline from now until the launch of the TWV Academy:

 

 

For the past 15 weeks we were already in contact with the most amazing teachers to be leading a huge variety of classes. We are also aiming to continue our relationship with these amazing teachers who have already been already part of the TWV family... previous teachers include:

Alleyne Dance, Anton Lachky, Caroline Finn, Chisato Ohno, Jose Agudo, Julyen Hamilton, Lali Ayguade, Lewis Cooke, Raymond Chai, Sam Coren, Winifred Burnet-Smith, Vittoria di Ferrari

The TWV Academy will become the meeting point between the online classes and our signature year-long online presence training. 

Within the first 15 weeks participants of the year-long programme could also become acquainted with the pillars of Towards Vivencia methodology to train peak performance presence, designed to trigger that specific state of consciousness where we feel extremely present within our current experience, as if we become both the architects and inhabitants of our world and how we play within it. Now, with the Academy, we have the opportunity to share this methodology in a completely new and exciting way while at the same time take classes with the best dance-artists of the entire world.Each term of the TWV Academy will be 15 weeks long. The programme of classes offered through the Academy will be specifically curated so that it is in sync with the content of the online presence training giving you the opportunity to have the most complete and holistic training yet. 

All the perks acquired during this crowdfunding campaign will be redeemed once the TWV Academy opens its doors! 

 If you are a participant of the 1-year programme, the Academy offers you a chance to supplement your training through a very practical and highly relevant application, testing out what you’ve discovered throughout your training. 

If you haven’t enrolled in the 1-year programme yet, not to worry. Alongside this commitment to the methodology, we also will be programming artists who’s teaching practices embody the spirit of the methodology, a fresh take on how to cultivate performance presence. In this way, you will indirectly be employing the methodology that has helped over 300 people feel more confident, grounded, centered and above all, the grounding feeling of being enough!

Regardless of what training you have committed to, you will have access to highly-specialised classes, all brought together in one place in order to go beyond what we know as traditional training

In order to ensure that these classes reflect not only the methodology, but also the needs of our community, we have set up a curatorial team to regularly review our programming and see what is possible for the Academy. We are currently in the process of assembling our first term of teachers and classes for September, so stay tuned to this campaign and across our social media for when we announce the programme. 

If you are subscribing for a term or for a year, this home is your home, so you will have a say in whose teachers are invited the following term.

 

We have always valued transparency regarding how finances and our internal workings are handled within TWV and this campaign is no different. 

The costs of running this platform fall into 3 main categories:

• Paying the artists who will leading the classes for the first 15 weeks.

• Supporting the small team working behind the scenes at TWV

• The digital construction platform and its ongoing maintenance

The numbers we have chosen for this campaign are reflective of what we know people can do, and what we know

For a full breakdown of the money we need to generate to make this home possible view the budget HERE. 

(please notice that there are two different tabs, one for the work behind kickstarting the project and one for running the TWV Academy till the end of 2020)

Or you can visit the transparency section on our website: https://towardsvivencia.com/transparency

 

We know that these are turbulent times. If you cannot help build this home through finances, there are other ways to take part in its construction.

One of the driving forces behind the rapid growth of the TWV community is word of mouth, you speaking about your experience with your colleagues, friends, families. The goal is ultimately to make the world feel a little less smaller than it did yesterday, meaning we can all be closer than ever before.

We want you to be a part of this community, in whatever way is manageable for you. So if it not financially possible for you to contribute to this campaign, we ask that you share this page and keep telling people about TWV.

Follow us on Instagram: towards_vivencia
And Facebook: Towards Vivencia

And that's all there is to it... for now!

We are also aiming to continue our relationship with these amazing teachers who have already been already part of the TWV family... previous teachers include:Alleyne Dance, Anton Lachky, Caroline Finn, Chisato Ohno, Jose Agudo, Julyen Hamilton, Lali Ayguade, Lewis Cooke, Raymond Chai, Sam Coren, Winifred Burnet-Smith, Vittoria di FerrariThe TWV Academy will become the meeting point between the online classes and our signature year-long online presence training. Within the first 15 weeks participants of the year-long programme could also become acquainted with the pillars of Towards Vivencia methodology to train peak performance presence, designed to trigger that specific state of consciousness where we feel extremely present within our current experience, as if we become both the architects and inhabitants of our world and how we play within it. Now, with the Academy, we have the opportunity to share this methodology in a completely new and exciting way while at the same time take classes with the best dance-artists of the entire world.Each term of the TWV Academy will be 15 weeks long. The programme of classes offered through the Academy will be specifically curated so that it is in sync with the content of the online presence training giving you the opportunity to have the most complete and holistic training yet. All the perks acquired during this crowdfunding campaign will be redeemed once the TWV Academy opens its doors!  If you are a participant of the 1-year programme, the Academy offers you a chance to supplement your training through a very practical and highly relevant application, testing out what you’ve discovered throughout your training. If you haven’t enrolled in the 1-year programme yet, not to worry. Alongside this commitment to the methodology, we also will be programming artists who’s teaching practices embody the spirit of the methodology, a fresh take on how to cultivate performance presence. In this way, you will indirectly be employing the methodology that has helped over 300 people feel more confident, grounded, centered and above all, the grounding feeling of being enough!Regardless of what training you have committed to, you will have access to highly-specialised classes, all brought together in one place in order to go beyond what we know as traditional trainingIn order to ensure that these classes reflect not only the methodology, but also the needs of our community, we have set up a curatorial team to regularly review our programming and see what is possible for the Academy. We are currently in the process of assembling our first term of teachers and classes for September, so stay tuned to this campaign and across our social media for when we announce the programme. If you are subscribing for a term or for a year, this home is your home, so you will have a say in whose teachers are invited the following term. We have always valued transparency regarding how finances and our internal workings are handled within TWV and this campaign is no different. The costs of running this platform fall into 3 main categories:• Paying the artists who will leading the classes for the first 15 weeks.• Supporting the small team working behind the scenes at TWV• The digital construction platform and its ongoing maintenanceThe numbers we have chosen for this campaign are reflective of what we know people can do, and what we knowFor a full breakdown of the money we need to generate to make this home possible view the budget HERE. (please notice that there are two different tabs, one for the work behind kickstarting the project and one for running the TWV Academy till the end of 2020)Or you can visit the transparency section on our website: https://towardsvivencia.com/transparency We know that these are turbulent times. If you cannot help build this home through finances, there are other ways to take part in its construction.One of the driving forces behind the rapid growth of the TWV community is word of mouth, you speaking about your experience with your colleagues, friends, families. The goal is ultimately to make the world feel a little less smaller than it did yesterday, meaning we can all be closer than ever before.We want you to be a part of this community, in whatever way is manageable for you. So if it not financially possible for you to contribute to this campaign, we ask that you share this page and keep telling people about TWV.Follow us on Instagram: towards_vivenciaAnd Facebook: Towards VivenciaAnd that's all there is to it... for now!

story:
Dario Fo and Franca Rame wrote these two plays in 1979, but they have never felt more relevant than now. 

We will perform both plays simultaneously, but with two visually different themes and flavours.   

These plays tackle the struggles of female liberation eloquently and humorously, and we feel our passion behind female empowerment, and our experiences and versatility as actresses will allow us to redeliver the play with a modern twist.

This project is not only important, it is also necessary. 

Following the recent Weinstein scandal, we know the world is ready to hear our truths and fight against these intolerable ongoings that occur not just within our industry, but across all walks of life, to all women of all colours, sizes and ages.

More importantly, we are ready to generate awareness and show the world that women have a voice. Things NEED to change. #TimesUp

 

https://www.imdb.com/name/nm5042853/

Vanina Arias was born in Switzerland of Italian and Chilean origin. She decided to leave to Paris where she attended courses at Florent School. She discovered the Actor Studio method 2 years later and fell in love with it instantly. She started with “café-théâtre” plays, where interaction with the public is essential. She then went on with other types of plays, often comic duets and was finally hired to play in short programs and TV shows. She got her first English speaking part on stage and performed for one month at the Hollywood Fringe Festival. Two years ago she moved to London and she got a part in the last "Death Race 4" with Danny Trejo. Vanina is not only passionate about acting but also loves dancing. She’s a good Cuban salsa and Argentinean tango dancer. Vanina is very perseverant and full of energy. She loves to travel and discover new things. She's fluent in French, Italian, English and Spanish.

https://www.imdb.com/name/nm3932815/

Deborah Durand is a French actress who has recently decided to open her career to the international market and work with Gilles Foreman in the GFCA school, as well as with Elisabeth Kemp, after having studied at the Art school of Grenoble. After graduating she went on to study acting in Cours Simon, a famous french acting school.She began acting professionally in Moliere's plays, and Marivaux, as well as lots of comedies such as "Complétement givrées" or a Dario Fo play "The Open couple". Her film credits include "Louise'diary" with Richard Bhoringer. Now she performs on stage in France in a play that she wrote "Un moment d'égarement" whilst develops her writing, working on plays and series.

 

It's a self funded play and the donation will help with the cost of the show:

- Theater rent / Tech. Assistant / Flyer / Video /  Festival fees / Travel / Hotel

The money will be only to cover the fees.

If we don't succeed, we will :

1. Cry

2. Drink to forget 

3. Eat rice for 3 months. 

 
Your contribution will help to participate in a culturally relevant albat, difficult cause in a light hard way. 
 
The time has come to speak out loud about this topic and make participating in the change that's already happening. 
If we don't reach our goal we won't be able to contribute to the conversation with our play. 

 

We need your help in every way. Share this page on your social, to your network and to anyone who is a passionate feminist. 

Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

Just Outside the Door was selected to participate in the 2019 Broadway Bound Theatre Festival. That means it will get an Off-Broadway world premiere this summer! This can only happen with your help! 

We will have three performances in a New York theater right on 42nd street!

OUR PERFORMANCE DATES:

Wednesday July 31 @ 5pm

Thursday August 1 @ 8pm

Friday August 2 @ 2pm

 

PERFORMANCE LOCATION:

THE LION THEATRE

410 W 42ND STREET

NEW YORK, NY 10036

What We Need

We need to raise $6,500 in order to bring this small idea to the New York stage! Here is a breakdown of where that money would go.

Staff & Actors: $4,000

Production Costs: $1,000

Rehearsal Space: $1,000

Insurance: $200

Indiegogo Fees: $300

 

The Impact

You will be helping make this dream a reality ...

  • You will ensure this story of a Cuban grandmother and her grandson reaches a wider audience.
  • You will personally be responsible for bringing an original work to a New York City stage!
  • You will help make it possible that the first time I make it to New York is to see a production of my own work!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially, there are other ways you can still help!

  • Spread the word and share this campaign!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Like our Facebook page.
  • Spread the word on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.

And most importantly ... Come see the show either July 31, August 1, or August 2!

story:
The Plot

A boarding school in the German Democratic Republic, 1983. A teenage girl, abandoned by her parents, finds comfort in the relationship with her teacher, Thomas. But will her brother understand? What will happen if her friend’s illegal activities are discovered by the authorities? And who are the dark figures who visit Thomas at night?

Ideology and Hair Gel uses live music, shadow puppetry, stunning movement and fast-paced action to explore themes of misplaced power, vulnerability, homosexuality and femininity.

 

Who We Are

Waspish Theatre Company was set up in 2018 by an all-female creative team, each with a passion to give a voice to the vulnerable. Ideology and Hair Gel, written by Lizzie Corscaden and directed by Bethany-Ann Wilkinson, is Waspish Theatre's first full-length production, and examines the effects of political turmoil on the young and powerless.

The Edinburgh Fringe is the perfect place to showcase this politically-charged piece and launch Waspish Theatre into the spotlight, so that we can continue to give a voice to the unheard.

'If I be waspish, best beware my sting'- The Taming of the Shrew by William Shakespeare

 

The Cast and Crew

In April 2019, we were delighted to announce the immensely talented Cast and Crew that will be taking Ideology and Hair Gel to Edinburgh:

Cast

Heather Kirk – Elvira Tolsdorf
Will Maidment – Thomas Behler
Natasha Thurrell – Nina Hofman and understudy Elvira Tolsdorf
Sophie Max – Kat Meier
Niamh Smith – Petra Roth
Jack Pursglove – Frank Tolsdorf and Hans Fischer
Callum Pardoe – Erik Schulz, Herr Richter and Stefan
Sophie Barton – Nadine, Frau Tolsdorf and understudy Nina Hofman and Kat Meier
Laura England – Ensemble and Hanna Behler
Drew Burnham – Ensemble and understudy Nadine and Frau Tolsdorf

Crew

Director – Bethany Wilkinson
Playwright and Dramaturg – Lizzie Corscaden
Assistant Director – Eleanor Rutter
Deputy Stage Manager – Emily Wilkinson
Producer – Eleanor Ball
Composer – Sean Simmons-Barry
Publicity Design – Charlotte Deacon

 

What We Need & What You Get

While the Edinburgh Fringe is the perfect place to showcase new work, it is also expensive. Your money will go towards registration fees, accommodation, venue hire, sets, props, costumes and much much more. We believe that theatre has the power to create positive change, and even the smallest donation will go along way towards making that happen.

But there are benefits for you too! By donating, you could get anything from a poster, to free tickets for the show, or even your own personalised photobook, signed by the entire cast and crew! Check out our perks for more details.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Here at Waspish Theatre we understand that a financial contribution isn't a viable option for everyone. But you can still support this project! Why not try one of the options below?

Share this page with your friends and family!

Follow us on: Facebook - Twitter - Instagram

Pop along to one of our fundraising events (See our social media pages for details)

Come and see the show, and bring everyone you know!

story:
Who We Are:

Theatre EVOLVE is a new company based in Chicago that is focused not only on the type of theatre we create, but the way we create it. Our goal is to be a foothold for emerging artists in the city to develop their skills, resumes, and expand their network. We are doing that by employing a minimum of 50% artists we have never worked with before, including actors, designers, playwrights, or directors with every single production we do.

As we embark on our mission to develop upcoming artists in the Chicago community, we recognize and value the importance of inclusion in our work. We are committed to reflecting the diversity of our nation’s culture at all levels: on our stage, in our audience, and on our staff.

 

Where We Are Going:

We are thrilled to fulfill our mission of artistic and professional development by producing a brand new play by Chicago based playwright, Will Coleman! Krugozor! is the story of Svetlana and Vitaly who grow up in the waning days of the Soviet Union, obsessed with Western Rock music, trying to find their place in art, life and government, and reconcile their dreams with reality. Krugozor! brings the real life story of one magazine and its impact on a generation through music and we are thrilled to give it it's world premiere.

Additionally, in our third season we look forward to offering classes between our season's productions. We are working on curricula that develop theatre makers artistically, as well as classes to help with the business side of being a working creative in the city. Resume and audition polishing? Quite possibly! Financial and tax workshops? Hello, I need that.

In listening for what our theatre community here in Chicago is needing developmentally, Theatre EVOLVE is also tuned in to the events of the world as a whole. As we move forward in shaping our season and selecting future shows, we intend to reflect what we hear and learn. We hope you will join us for those conversations and stories in our second season.

Why This Show Now?

Krugozor! impresses the idea that music reacts to hardships and enables us to endure them, that it connects us on personal and global levels, and that it facilitates the retelling of our memories. Krugozor! may take place in the Soviet Union, but we feel it's a show that is just as relevant to 2019 America. We are excited to bring that story into the theatre and the hearts of our audience. We hope you are too!

 

Where We’ve Been:

Season 1

In our 2018 Season, we produced an incredible production of Twelfth Night filled with some of Chicago's most amazing artists. Our three-week run had multiple sold out nights and rave reviews from our audience!

Additionally, we produced our first REvolve reading series! After a month of reading through the 260 play submissions we received from all over the country, we narrowed it down to seven 10-min plays and two full length pieces. With packed houses we were honored to produce REvolve with over 30 actors, playwrights, and directors.

Season 2

In the summer of 2019, we produced the World Premiere of Human Resource(s) by Sara Means, telling the sometimes-too-familiar story of corporate America and the extremes of clawing one's way to the top. The production was 'Recommended' by critics and left audiences aghast!

 

So Now The Real Question:

From the success of our last two shows we already have 60% of the money needed for Krugozor! We are asking for another $6000 to help ensure that we are able to continue actively raising our artist stipends in order to raise the bar on store front theatre!

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

We completely understand if you can’t make a financial donation. But there are other ways to help get Theatre EVOLVE’s production of Krugozor! up and running.

1. Please let all your friends and family know about this Indiegogo campaign. Even your crazy Aunt Clara. Tweet about it. Facebook about it. Instagram, Snap, Message, Text, Email away. Use the Indiegogo share tools and help us spread the word. This is the most important thing you can do!

2. If you’re a Chicago business owner and you’d like to get involved in some way – whether it be taking an ad in the program or donating goodies for the opening night party, get in touch with us at theatreevolve@gmail.com

3. Please come see the show! We run the month of April, 2020 at the Athenaeum Theatre in Studio 1.

FOR MORE INFO, VISIT www.theatreevolve.com

story:
From June 10-20, Philadelphia Asian Performing Artists (PAPA) will celebrate the ingenuity and necessity of our Pan-Asian performing arts community with our virtual festival COME TO PAPA.  With live and pre-recorded performances, workshops, community meals, pitch sessions, showcases, and more, we’re creating space for artists of Pan-Asian descent, audiences, administrators, and presenters alike to forge relationships and COME TO PAPA.

COME TO PAPA provides paid opportunities for 50+ artists of Pan-Asian descent. We are raising $10,000 to cover stipends and production costs for our technical staff, Playwrights Project Readings, Community Meals, Workshop series, and national networking events and pitch sessions that will create opportunities for local artists to be seen by arts organizations across the country.  

Philadelphia Asian Performing Artists (PAPA) is a small all-volunteer community and arts organization.  Your tax deductible donation will truly mean the world to us as we work to tell Unapologetically Asian stories and curate ambitious programming that celebrates this lineage, heritage, and our members' political and personal histories. 

We want a world where artists of Pan-Asian descent can tell their stories -- at any volume, in any language, with any textures they choose -- without fear or shame. This is a world we must build for ourselves and COME TO PAPA is a major building block in our mission.

story:
Where or When is a play about heart, and how everyone has their own story. Written by Jonathan Ewing and Erica Toews, they created this story out of personal experiences that we have all had to deal with in our lives. Loss, disappointment, and fear of change. This is a story that deserves to be told. Together with Infinite Imagination Traveling Theatre and Typecast Anonymous Productions, you can make that happen. In the midst of a global pandemic, life has been tough for everyone, including artists. Artists have always built a community around support, love, and understanding. However, those doors have been shut for almost a year now. We wish to change this, while still doing our part to limit the spread of COVID-19. The fundraising goal behind this project is to create an experience and film the production so it can be a continued source of inspiration to artists in the community.  Families and individuals will be able to rent the production and forget about the troubles in their lives... if only for a night. While we think it is important to tell the story of Where or When, we want to do it the right way. That's why we are asking for a fundraising goal of 4,000 dollars. The money will go to the cost of filming, sets, costumes and venue rental. In our updates we will provide a breakdown of where each dollar is spent. Our vision is that it will feel as if you were in the theatre yourselves. 

 

Our number one risk is COVID-19. With the real burden of restrictions and lockdowns, it not only takes a financial toll but also an emotional one. Our goal is to produce this show at the end of March. However, we understand that this may not be possible. Regardless, we will commit to producing this production as soon as possible with a team dedicated to seeing this play to completion. For this project, we have chosen flexible funding because we will produce this show regardless of the funds we receive. However, if we are able to reach our goal (Or beyond), that will allow us to create this show without the worry of financial burden and we can focus on telling a story that deserves to see the limelight.
story_txt:
Where or When is a play about heart, and how everyone has their own story. Written by Jonathan Ewing and Erica Toews, they created this story out of personal experiences that we have all had to deal with in our lives. Loss, disappointment, and fear of change. This is a story that deserves to be told. Together with Infinite Imagination Traveling Theatre and Typecast Anonymous Productions, you can make that happen. In the midst of a global pandemic, life has been tough for everyone, including artists. Artists have always built a community around support, love, and understanding. However, those doors have been shut for almost a year now. We wish to change this, while still doing our part to limit the spread of COVID-19. The fundraising goal behind this project is to create an experience and film the production so it can be a continued source of inspiration to artists in the community.  Families and individuals will be able to rent the production and forget about the troubles in their lives... if only for a night. While we think it is important to tell the story of Where or When, we want to do it the right way. That's why we are asking for a fundraising goal of 4,000 dollars. The money will go to the cost of filming, sets, costumes and venue rental. In our updates we will provide a breakdown of where each dollar is spent. Our vision is that it will feel as if you were in the theatre yourselves. 
 
Our number one risk is COVID-19. With the real burden of restrictions and lockdowns, it not only takes a financial toll but also an emotional one. Our goal is to produce this show at the end of March. However, we understand that this may not be possible. Regardless, we will commit to producing this production as soon as possible with a team dedicated to seeing this play to completion. For this project, we have chosen flexible funding because we will produce this show regardless of the funds we receive. However, if we are able to reach our goal (Or beyond), that will allow us to create this show without the worry of financial burden and we can focus on telling a story that deserves to see the limelight.

story:
CUBE Ensemble presents Faces of Eurydice, a new dance - opera - theater retelling of the myth of Orpheus. With choreographic direction by Hope Goldman, music and lyrics by Hope Littwin, and stage direction by Janet Howe, the often overlooked perspective of Eurydice, Orpheus’s legendary lover, comes alive.

This is CUBE's first original dance-opera-theatre piece devised entirely by the cast and creative team of Faces of Eurydice. After over a year and a half of devising and 2 workshop performances, the stage is set for the world premiere of Faces of Eurydice.


Short Summary

Hi! My name is Hope, I am the Artistic Director of CUBE Ensemble and the Composer of Faces of Eurydice. This new Dance-Opera-Theater work was born out of a desire to make a new genre of Opera that would absorb the best of the best in new dance, music and theater!

I found our Choreographic Director, Hope Goldman, at a showing of process pieces that she presented back in the summer of 2013 and knew right then and there that I wanted to work with her. Her choreography is the most exciting dance I have seen in Chicago. It is daring, theatrical, and explores sides of femininity that are not often portrayed in theater.

Our totally badass performers: Lia, Vienna, Beth, Alex, Allison, Kroy and Jeremy are classically trained in music, dance and theater and with them we have devised a piece of incredible magnitude.  Faces of Eurydice is sharp, lush, expansive, heart wrenching and truly one of a kind. 

 With your help we can cover the costs of a black box theater and the high quality promotion necessary to share this labor of love (a year and a half in the making) with Chicago! We will also be able to pay our performers and design team a stipend for all of their incredible work! 


What We Need & What You Get

We have already raised a quarter of our 10,900 budget! The money we raised has already gone toward part of our rehearsal space costs and making a downpayment on the Theater. Here is where the rest is going!

$4,500 covers a year and a half of Rehearsal Space!

$3,300 covers our Black Box Theater for three weekends of shows!!!

$500 covers our Printing Costs!

$300 pays our press material designer!

$100 pays our Videographer!

$100 pays our Stage Manager!

$100 pays a Director's stipend (there are 2)

$200 a Performer's stipend (there are 7)

$200 pays for Costumes!

$200 pays for Lighting rental!

$50 pays our Lighting designer!

$50 pays our Sound Engineer!


The Impact

Id like to share a fable with you

(sparknotes version: you, dear donor, are a hero to a young generation of innovative artists)

A recently graduated Opera/Music Composition student with a background in classical dance and music theater is thrust into the professional world where she soon discovers a lack of work that she feels represents her generation/anything that has happened in the last 100 years... She loves opera but usually falls asleep when she goes to see it. She wants to latch on to a theatrical heroine in said genre, but they are usually sickly/insane/heartless killers...Great...

 She often plays jams sessions with her incredibly talented musician friends around Chicago who absorb ALL OF THE STYLES: pop, jazz, classical, folk, rock, blues, punk, electronic, you name it.. These friends wish they could find a way to collaborate with theatre but they believe theater people only want "music theater" and they would prefer to have a little more freedom/sophistication than their understanding of said genre.

She also goes to see dance companies around the city and is sad, so. so. so. sad to see them performing these new beautiful creations to...recordings...yes, friends, canned music. Played off their ipods. ~tear~ Truly they deserve more than this...and I know just the people to give it to them. 

This wee composer begins to build a group of performers spanning the three genres that have high skill on their respective instruments, an ability to work in both abstract and narrative exercises and have top notch improvissational skills with which to build a new language/genre of music theater. 

Together they spend a year and a half developing a new language as they bring new level of sophistication to Music Theater that it has been generally lacking. They call it Dance Opera Theater and it has changed their worlds, blown their minds! They say things like "We really do have a place and a voice in this genre!" and "What we love and care about can be absorbed into said genre and shared in Theaters around the world!" 

This group of talented, hard working, determined artists paradigm-shifted (words are invented, not discovered) not only their own perspective but the perspective of many a young, hungry recent music/theater/dance graduates searching for their voice. They are all filled with hope and humbled in deep gratitude for the group of devoted collaborators who donated funds to make such work possible! Because of this enthusiasm and support they now believe that if they work hard to make new, excellently crafted, relevant work in their genuine voice, a group of incredible, generous, artists/activists/community leaders will support these efforts! 

Risks & Challenges

Go big or go home! we like to say...

Risks and challenges hm? That may sum up most of the journey of making a new piece of collaborative Music Theater. 

Most of us have given a year and a half of our lives to make this work come to life.

True I am a youngin by producer standards but my background in producing is something I can look back on with great pride. I began booking my own tours and studio time as a sixteen year-old songwriter, which led me into developing shows with singer-songwriters, bands, visual artists, choral ensembles and now, collaborative Music Theater groups. I have produced over 30 unique shows, a good number of which toured multiple times. I have found and delivered funds to all involved artists in every single one of these projects. 

All of this is to say, where there is a will, there is a way and ladies and gentlemen, I have will for days. 

Other Ways You Can Help

You love our passion, our product, and our enthusiasm for a new genre of opera/music theater/lyric theater? But no has cash? Thats okay. We understand. 


You can still Help us!

  • Spread the word about our indiegogo Campaign! (use the share tools! and talk about it! outloud! in words!)
  • Come to our fundraiser and tell us that you are excited about the work we are doing. We will probably cry from happiness and hug you.

Details

3 singers, 2 dancers, 1 actor, 1 cellist and electronics. 


PRESALES

$25 admission 

$10 industry/student


REGULAR TICKETS

$35 admission

$15 industry/student



Faces of Eurydice


Choreographic Director: Hope Goldman

Composer: Hope Littwin

Stage Director: Janet Howe


Performers: Beth Berta, Jeremy Cairns, Allison Cook, Kroydell Gallima, Lia Kohl, Hope Littwin, Alexandra Olsavsky, and Vienna Willems

story:
HILLARY CONFIDENTIAL 2.0 – PRE-MADAME PRESIDENT

You too can help by joining our great team of indie supporters from all over the world.  Check out our long list of PERKS from CONGRESSIONAL RUNNER TO PRESIDENT!

  • What's the most important thing, worldwide, occurring right now?  The United States Presidential Election!  This event affects literally every human being on the planet! What happens in the US doesn’t stay in the US!  And what's the scariest thing out there?  Donald Trump!  Both ignorance and intelligence affect you and never let you go.  With HILLARY CONFIDENTIAL 2.0, we're exploring both.  If you're a Democrat or an intelligent Republican and not addicted to Trump, where do you go?  HILLARY CONFIDENTIAL 2.0!
  • Chuck Karel, our director, has assembled a cast of extraordinarily gifted entertainers to help tell the story of the battle for the US Presidency with comedy and music. With your help WE CAN DO THIS!  It'll be fun, and it'll all be thanks to you.  Join us!  There's always room for more!
  • Kelley Karel, singer/actor and “The Singing Hillary Clinton,” has been a dead-ringer Hillary impersonator for over 24 years.  As "Hillary," she has performed numerous times on television, including Conan O'Brien, soap operas and a variety of news and human interest programs.  With her dead-on impersonation of Hillary Clinton, sharp improv skills, customized writing and clean, corporate, sensitive comedy, Kelley has worked in the corporate arena for many Fortune 500 companies in live corporate theater and interactive comedy shows as a speaker, host and emcee. 
  • Your contributions will assist us in making HILLARY CONFIDENTIAL 2.0 a successful cabaret production.

Remember, that even $5 makes a difference, but perhaps your skills can be equally as valuable. What do you do?  Contact us at singinghillaryclinton@gmail.com (Subject: ATT: HILLARY CONFIDENTIAL 2.0), and let us know how you can contribute by joining our professional team.

Where does the money go?

  • Funds for a cabaret presentation go to venue rental, rehearsals, coaching, original material, costumes, makeup, wigs, cast, musicians, & publicity.

Why HILLARY CONFIDENTIAL 2.0?

  • After 4 sold out shows in February and April, this brand new show has a bigger cast and says much more about Trump and Hillary. 

Risks & Challenges

Though Kelley & Chuck Karel are the only true volunteers, there are things like transportation, venue rental, rehearsals, coaching, original material, costumes, makeup, wigs, cast, musicians, & publicity that are not free.

  • The $5,000 goal is really the minimum for us to make it happen.  Ideally we would love $35,000 to recoup expenses from our first HILLARY CONFIDENTIAL show the beginning of this year. 
  • From the moment you contribute, your name will be forever attached to this exciting project. It's up to you to help us make it incredible. 

Other Ways You Can Help

As mentioned above, let us know what you do and what you can do for us. We're a very nice team of people, as eclectic as possible, and we love to welcome new members.

Don't be shy. 

If you share this with a personal message to 10 people, imagine the opportunities.  Perhaps someone in your entourage is dreaming to be in the comedy cabaret business. Let them know.  Sharing on your own social pages will bring more traffic to our campaign.  Nothing you do to spread the word is too small!  We thank you and look forward to meeting you.

SPECIAL PERK SINGING HILLARY CLINTON T-SHIRT

We are also offering a limited edition perk.  Get a HILLARY CONFIDENTIAL 2.0 T Shirt! Check out the T-Shirt picture just below the video above.

story:
About PeachPie Productions

PeachPie Productions was founded in San Francisco in 2013 by NYU graduate, Celeste Makoff. The production company’s most recent show, Bottled Up, went up in Manhattan last summer, 2015 at the DCTV Center in TriBeCa. PeachPie Productions has sold out every performance and each production has brought in new vital members to its creative team. All of our production team members have graduated in the past eight years from several prestigious universities and conservatories.

Mission Statement

PeachPie's mission is to give specifically new artists the framework to exercise their talents in order to gain the experience they need to take on a career in the arts.

About the Show

In the world of Crashlight, tens of millions of people in a dystopian/Orwell-esque future have only three minutes of sunlight a day. This small amount of light is controlled by a fascist dictator, Marcus Pressi; a master of propaganda, a master of power and control by censorship. Rian, an illegal violin maker in the dark leaves her home and two sisters after discovering that "someone in the sky hides the light away." With courage, she disguises herself as the enemy in an attempt to reveal a beautiful freedom to those who don't even know one exists. Her original story and never before heard music expresses our capacity as people to desire truth and the divine power of communication through music.


The Creatives

Celeste Makoff (Director/Writer/Producer)

Kaitlyn Moise (Co-Producer, Choreographer)

Trevor Bumgarner (Musical Arrangements)

Sean Kiely (Sound Design)

Aaron Duffy (Video Production & Design)

Shirlee Idzakovich (Costume Designer)

Maria Puglisi (Assistant Choreographer)

Kaitlyn Miller (Stage Manager)

Siavash Almeida (Graphic Design)


What We Need & What You Get

We have our amazing venue and our full cast - so your donations will help us fund:

  • rehearsal space
  • costumes
  • set pieces
  • sound design
  • videography
  • actor stipends

$20: Special thank you card sent via mail

$50: Special thank you card sent via mail and special thanks in our program

$100: Special thank you card sent via mail and special thanks in our program, and signed program from the Cast and Crew sent to you

$350: Special thank you card sent via mail and special thanks in our program, signed program from the Cast and Crew sent to you, and a signed poster

$500: Special thank you card sent via mail and special thanks in our program, signed program from the Cast and Crew sent to you, a signed poster, a digital shout via our Facebook page, and  two complimentary tickets to opening night with RESERVED front row seating

$1,000:  Special thank you card sent via mail and special thanks in our program, signed program from the Cast and Crew sent to you, a signed poster, a digital shout out via our Facebook page, and  two complimentary tickets to opening night with RESERVED front row seating, and a signed bottle of champagne from the Cast

The Impact

When you donate to our Indiegogo Page you will also help us to pay our hard working actors. We feel it is important to support and bring attention to the thousands of actors in NYC who are willing to give their art for free. These hard working artists often must juggle at least one or two other jobs to support themselves all in the name of trying to pursue their passion of theater and performing. We believe that actors provide a valuable asset to the community especially when it comes to delivering important messages or educating our youth on the world.  

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Like us on Facebook!
  • Follow us on Instagram!
  • Come see the show! Follow our Facebook Event Page premiering at The Cherry Lane Theatre in the West Village on April 25, 2016 - September 11, 2016. 


THANK YOU FOR ALL YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
Guards at the Taj

 

  • We are two NYC based actors, Ramiq Harris and Bryan Hamilton. Both having worked in the theatre for the last few years; Henry V, Double "I", Stage Beauty ( Ramiq Harris ). Romeo and Juliet, Golden Boy, Land of Broken Toys ( Bryan Hamilton ).
  • Our campaign is to raise funds for the play, Guards at the Taj, written by Rajiv Joseph. The production will go up at the Times Square Arts Center- John Desotelle Studio ( 300 W 43rd Street, NY, NY 10036, 3rd floor ), on September 8th - 10th ( Thursday - Saturday, 7:30PM ), and September 11th ( Sunday - 7:00PM ).

               We started this journey in a very unique fashion. The two of us are a part of an unofficial theatre group that trains with Master Acting teacher, Richard Pinter, on a consistent basis. The goal of our training is training itself, however, the two of us wanted to explore moving from scenes to full length plays. We started working on Guards, completely by ourselves at first, with no intention of putting it up for the public. We both absolutely fell in love this play and we met in different parks and studios to rehearse everyday, despite our busy schedules. Eventually, we brought in our work and workshopped it with our theatre group. We have received encouragement from our fellow peers to put up this show and both have a strong desire to share our work and challenge ourselves further. We have faith in what we're doing and we have faith in the fact that Theatre, at its highest level, is an art form that can serve humanity like no other.  Putting ourselves out there and playing this play for the audience is something we feel is essential for our growth as actors. Contributors would help us enormously to achieve that goal.

What We Need

 

We are trying to raise 4500$ for our whole production. All of this goes towards;

  •  the space of the theater
  •  the rights to the play
  • performer's insurance
  • professional stage manager
  • crew ( 2 people )
  • lighting and sound designer
  • building materials for our set
  • costumes 
  • prop pieces.

Our Impact

 

As artists, we strive every day to serve the story the best way we can.We have been working hard every day to insure that we do justice to this play, and those who come see it. We sacrifice ourselves so this story can reach out and touch people, to inspire them to live life to the fullest, as theatre reminds us to do so. 

Help us spread the word!

 

  • We are extremely greatful to those who may not be able to help us out with a contribution, but a share, a like, telling your friends and family or simply coming to watch us perform will contribute towards our goal!! Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!! You can use the Indiegogo share tools!!

We thank you very much!!

 

BUY TICKETS!

http://m.bpt.me/event/2592605

story:
A Father, A Son, Their Story.

Help us bring "The Fifth Dentist in Search of Sid's Treasure" to Denver Colorado!

Written as a love letter to his late father, the infamous owner of “Sid King’s Crazy Horse Bar,” Mike King performs his life story about being a dentist, a stand up comedian, and the son of a “nightclub” owner. A heart-warming, hilarious tribute to his father Sid King, “The Sultan of Striptease.”

"The Fifth Dentist in Search of Sid's Treasure" will make it's world premiere at The Studio Loft at Denver Performing Arts Complex on Saturday August 6th, 2016.  All proceeds from ticket sales will benefit the Children's Hospital Colorado, Sid's favorite charity.  The show is written and performed by Mike King, and directed by award-winning Broadway director Jonathan Cerullo.

Mike King is a veteran of stand up comedy.  He's appeared on Comedy Central, America's Funniest Home Videos, Evening at the Improv, and has opened many times for Ray Romano.  It's always been a  dream of his to bring the story of his late father Sid King to the stage.  Now, after years of working on his script and assembling a creative team in New York City, he is bringing his show home to Denver Colorado - but we need your help!

Why We're Crowd-funding

We're raising funds on Indiegogo for the production costs of bringing the play to Denver.   In addition to the ticket sales, once all costs are covered, anything extra will go to Children's Hospital.  There will be drinks, food, special guests, and an after-party.  Sid King was a huge supporter of Children's Hospital donating tens of thousands of dollars in the 70's and 80's, and we're thrilled to be performing this show to benefit this hospital. 

Production Costs Include:

  • Venue Costs, rehearsal & performance space
  • Creative Team - Director, Producers, Cast
  • Flights for Creative Team from NYC to Denver
  • Publicity for the event/fundraiser
  • Costumes, props
  • Stage Manager

Why Denver?

Sid King and his Crazy Horse Bar were legends on Colfax Avenue.  To this day people still talk about the late great Sid King and his infectious personality. Since Denver was extremely important to Sid, it's very special to have the World Premiere of "The Fifth Dentist in Search of Sid's Treasure" one mile from where his Crazy Horse Bar was located.   We decided to bring Sid Back to life to support his favorite charity, and pay tribute to "The Sultan of Striptease"

story:
Hello,

Oxen|free|theatre is committed to telling great stories simply, honestly and beautifully.  A compelling piece of theatre is the result of not just the actors, or even the director, but an entire team of people unified by a single objective: to create a vivid, exciting, and complete world into which an audience can enter for the purposes of community, entertainment and enlightenment. Our designers, producers, production managers, stage managers and directors all work together from the inception of the project to help create a single and cohesive vision that is greater than the sum of its parts.  Taste is subjective, quality is not.  We are committed to producing theatre of the highest calibre. 

In the Spring of 2017 we'll be mounting the Canadian Premiere of Sarah Ruhl's stunning and hilarious modern odyssey, "Dead Man's Cell Phone".  The play is a tragicomic exploration of our need for connection and intimacy in the modern world.  Not only is the play of the utmost relevance to today's audience, it is also the perfect embodiment of the values our company hopes to cultivate in our work.  It places high demands on everyone involved; the space, the designers, the technicians, director, and the actors.  It's big and bold and cannot be done without your support.

With your help we'll be able give this play the production it demands and in turn give the community the quality of performance they so deserve.  

CAST: Liisa Repo-Martell, Gregory Prest, Ryan Hollyman, and Tennille Read (further casting announcements to be revealed)

Director: Justin Goodhand

Producer: Laura Paduch

Costumes: Lindsay Dagger Junkin

Set & Lights: Nick Blais

Sound: Andy Trithardt

What We Need & What You Get

The costs of making theatre in a city like Toronto are substantial.  We are not deterred by this.  In order to create the standard of work we believe is required, we're working with a budget of more than $50,000.00.  This money goes towards renting the theatre venue, rehearsal space, material costs, marketing costs, and money for all of the artists involved who are giving their time and skill to the production. Though we need these funds, we're not asking you for all of them.  We've been hard at work seeking corporate sponsorships, government grants, and every other available source of funding.  

In exchange for your support we have some very exciting and unique perks.  If you donate, not only will you be giving a huge gift to us, but to the Canadian arts community as well; theatre makers and audiences alike.  That being said, we want to express our gratitude in other ways. Depending on the level of contribution, we're offering a variety of perks such as original design sketches, framed set renderings, invited dress rehearsals, hand written thank-you notes on the stationary in the show, and dinner with the director and cast.  Not enough?  How about we'll put your name in the show, said live on the night of your choosing?  How about you leave us a voicemail message and we'll play in the show?  Or maybe you'd like one of the hand-made blue raincoats you'll see swishing across the stage.  All of these things are for you.  On top of that, we will sing your praises from the rooftops on social media and even in our program.

If we don't reach our funding goals, things will inevitably have to be scaled down. Our goals are not based on a fantasy, but truly on what we feel we need to do this thing right.  If we come up short we will downsize, but only to a point. The money we hope to pay the artists working tirelessly will go down. And finally there will be a point where the show will not happen at all should the money not be there, because we feel it would be better not to do the show at all than to do it poorly. 

Other Ways You Can Help!

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

We understand not everyone is in a position to give money.  That doesn't mean you can't help us out!  If you do nothing us, please share our campaign with as many people as you can.  You never know who might be interested.  

Help us get our social media buzz going by following us on Twitter @oxenfreetheatre , on Instagram @oxen_free_theatre , or follow us on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/oxenfreetheatre

At the end of the day, if you do all, any, or none of these things for us, we hope you'll join us at the Tarragon Theatre in May for what is sure to be a night of thrilling theatre.

story:
Step in to the heart of an abandoned cottage on a remote Scottish island. A profound evocation of loss and poetic culture, summoned in this swirling surround multimedia performance. It’s Scotland but not as you know it!

"the footage of a long-abandoned home with its decaying interiors and clutter of personal effects reached out to all of us. Stirred thoughts of loss and of leaving that shaded from the realm of stone and mortar towards mortality itself."  The Herald 

 

Taking The Dwelling Place To The Fringe

Our project to take The Dwelling Place to the Fringe is the culmination of three years of developing and creating an art work that is deeply important to us. The ideas and vision of the project come from a heartfelt desire to give audiences a captivating and unconventional theatre experience. The mysterious world of the abandoned house we discovered is one that has deep resonance and insight in to our universal condition. 

We invite audiences in to this world, to make it tangible, to be able to reach out and feel it all around you.  We draw on all of our creative skills and love of the live experience by innovating with the latest technology available in digital art and sound, while mixing it with our years of professional experience in theatre, film and music. 

After many years of dedicated work as artists, we have the a special chance to bring our own original work to the best venue available, taking our artistic careers to a whole new level. 

Who are we?

Jamie is a multidisciplinary artist who has presented high profile work at the Fringe for the past five years. He trained as an actor at the Royal Conservatoire of Scotland. This year he has toured the UK, Poland and Palestine with his live visuals designs for Marc Brew’s solo dance For Now I Am and will VJ on the main stage of T In The Park with Rogue Orchestra in a tribute to David Bowie and Prince. Jamie runs a non profit studio in Glasgow to help leading professionals develop new work.

Lewis is a filmmaker by trade. He graduated in film from the Edinburgh College of Art and now works as a freelancer in the film industry. Recent credits include “Trainspotting 2” and being commissioned by the Scottish Film Talent Network to produce the short film “Close To The Bone”. Lewis has always been passionate about the moving image and narrative storytelling and is always looking for ways to experiment in the medium.

Together they experiment in film, music and theatre  

What we need funding to support?

We are presenting the show on a DIY and self funded basis. Any money we receive will be going on costs and expenses that are for essential for the project. Every penny will help us on our way.

Our main production costs are:

  • Van Hire to transport equipment and set 
  • Venue Hire and Fringe Registration Costs
  • Public Transport for Artists
  • Health and Safety - making sure our equipment meets British standards and the space is safe for audiences. -  (PAT Testing, Fire safety and cabling concealment)
  •  Materials for the set design, including props, fabric and costume. 
  • Printing of marketing materials - flyers, posters and online
  • Hire or purchasing costs for key lighting, sound and projection equipment. 
  • Essential production consumables

 

We are prioritising these costs over paying ourselves for our time on the production.

We would love to able to offer more perks and rewards for the contributions we receive, however the nature of the performance and The Fringe strictly limits the number of tickets we can give away. If we can help you out with your projects or in the future we would love to hear from you. Art is at its best when it is a collaborative effort. 

It’s Show Time

We would love to see you at Summerhall from: 

Wednesday 3rd of August to Sunday 19th August (Except Thursday 4th & Monday 15th) // 4pm & 7pm

£12.00//£8.00​

https://tickets.edfringe.com/whats-on/dwelling-...

We would greatly appreciate if you can get the word out on your social networks.

Many thanks

story:
I am a journalist who has began writing about the arts in 1989 at Paper Magazine in New York City. Since moving to the Twin Cities in 1994 I have contributed to City Pages and, currently, the Star Tribune.

The opportunities to publish reviews in mainstream publications are fewer these days. Still, reviews play an important role in the life of a vibrant arts community. BigDanceTown blog recognizes that the Twin Cities are among the most active dance communities in the United States and deserves to consistent coverage. In fact, I wrote about the important role the Twin Cities plays nationally for dance in a 2011 Star Tribune article: http://www.startribune.com/minneapolis-big-danc...

The blog will begin with my own writing but the hope is that one day it can expand to include other contributors. For now I need to start slowly and build up the infrastructure. The risks to this project are pretty obvious - I can only do as much as time and finances allow. The benefits are that if it becomes a viable project I can secure additional funding support and potentially advertising to keep it going. 

Will the blog matter to the life of the arts community? Only time will tell. I have a full-time job as an attorney so this will only be a part-time project. I hope that it can make an impact and fill an increasingly large gap in arts journalism in Minnesota.

story: We are several young artists who are passionate about what we do and that we have a strong and defined artistic formation. United we decided to form a company, totally legal and reliable, in which we develop the young talent of many boys and girls who for lack of resources or simply for not having opportunities, have not been able to exploit and develop their talents in the arts. We want to impact a large number of people and communities, provide options for their lives and show them other ways to grow beyond the bad habits of the street. It is not easy to develop these projects because they are uphill on many occasions, but we are determined to continue and give the best of us to create future and with your help we can achieve it. We need at the moment a financing of $ 1000.00 dollars that will be destined to the production of our plays, costumes, scenery, premises, lights, etc. None of the members of Telon Azul, charges any remuneration for their work, all this we do for love and because we want to create a future. The funds raised are solely and exclusively for the production of our plays because we do not charge for belonging to our company nor do we charge our members for their costumes etc. Our greatest reward is for our young people to move into some of the branches of the arts we offer and have other options in their lives. The profits obtained in these functions are intended to support other social impact projects, completely. If you ask us if we have challenges and risks? We will answer that yes, like everything in life, but we have the best intentions and the best human resources to be able to get ahead with your help. Which can be a bit difficult? We know it too and that is why we are turning to the help of all of you. It is important that you know that not only can you help us with some monetary contribution but also by spreading this project on your social networks and recommending your friends and family to support initiatives like this. Thank you.

We know it too and that is why we are turning to the help of all of you. It is important that you know that not only can you help us with some monetary contribution but also by spreading this project on your social networks and recommending your friends and family to support initiatives like this. Thank you.

story:
THE PORTABLE DOROTHY PARKER is going to the Edinburgh Fringe Festival this summer!!!!!

Actress Margot Avery, playwright Annie Lux, and director Lee Costello are taking their one-woman play based on the life of Dorothy Parker to the biggest theatre festival of them all.

We’ve done some terrific things with our show in the US:

  • SOLD OUT the 475-seat theatre at the Virginia Museum Of Fine Art in Richmond, VA.
  • Got great reviews at the Hollywood Fringe in Los Angeles and the Piccolo Spoletto Festival in Charleston, SC. 
    • " This portrait of Dot Parker, reminiscing on the who's who of her era, has legs — primarily for its ability to defy presumptions." --LA Weekly
  • SOLD OUT our run in FringeNYC 2015 and got some lovely reviews:
    • "We are treated to a cavalcade of irresistible Parkerisms as Avery inhabits her character with full authority and sharp comic timing. But perhaps more importantly, under Lee Costello’s skillful direction, she captures the nuanced sadness behind Parker’s great humor" --thefrontrowcenter.com
  • Had a successful weekend run in Annie’s home base of Santa Fe, NM (and we're heading back  soon.)

And now we’re going International!

But Edinburgh is very expensive. Some of our line items are:

  • ACCOMMODATIONS     (for 3)                               $ 6,500
  • AIRFARE (one way for one person)                      $ 1,300
  • MARKETING                                                                 $ 4,500+
    • ​(Publicity Services, Poster & Flyer Print & Distribution)  
  • VENUE                                                                              $3,450                      
    • (You get the idea.)

So we’re asking you--our friends, family, and fans--to chip in to help us get there.

Any amount will be most welcome and we’ve come up with a few fun ways to show our appreciation for whatever help you can give us (the “perks” listed over on the right).

And it’ll be tax deductible since Artistic New Directions is sponsoring us!

We’ll be sharing our adventure on Facebook so be sure to “like” The Portable Dorothy Parker page if you haven’t already.

Many many thanks from Annie, Margot, and Lee

story:
About the Production

Music and hearts are beating, and as the love stories are played out, a seemingly harmless prank goes horribly wrong resulting in a tragic fall from grace. 

 Our Twelfth Night is a direct response to our last show, Hamlet. As a company we have been immersed in expressing grief and trauma for the last two years and have now turned our creative forces toward love, music and romance. We finished Hamlet with the ghost of the drowned Ophelia speaking her own narrative to her brother, ‘I am drowned Laertes’. We begin Twelfth Night with the near drowned Viola as if picking up directly from where we left off. With the same actors - Francesca Zoutewelle and Finlay Cormack  - again playing brother and sister we are exploring, as Shakespeare did, where a narrative of courage and hope can lead us as the twins are reunited at the end of the play.

“The play seems as we read it to tremble perpetually on the brink of music” Virginia Woolf 

The show is performed by six young actors, who play all the music; they never leave the stage. Our tale explores love’s madness and our deep human need for music, whilst catching transgender inclinations, emotional transgressions and impossibly romantic reunions.

"Prove true, imagination oh prove true" Viola Act 3 sc 4

With nothing but benches to sit on, instruments to play and costumes and props that may have been washed up on a beach, the actors create an authentic, funny and moving experience for a 21st Century audience.

Director  Kelly Hunter

Composer Tom Chapman

How to Get Involved

We have been selected to perform at the Festival de Teatro Clásico de Almagro on Tuesday 25th July 2017 as part of the Almagro OFF. 150 companies applied, only 10 are chosen and only 4 are international- of which we are 1. This is an immensely exciting opportunity for Flute and this is where you come in. 

In order to create Twelfth Night, and share our music, love, and joy with the world at large, we need your help. By becoming a Flute Angel, and donating today, you can become a part the extraordinary journey that Twelfth Night makes. 

100% of each donation will go towards the creation and delivery of the production, and most importantly, enable us to reach and affect as wide an audience as possible. In return, we offer a broad wealth of thank yous including (but not limited to) original songs, sonnets, and exclusive entry into our rehearsal process. 

More details about our work can be found at www.flutetheatre.co.uk  and more information about Almagro Festival can be found at www.festivaldealmagro.com Further queries can be answered by emma@flutetheatre.co.uk  

Follow us on Twitter @FluteTheatre and Facebook to keep up to date on our work.

story:
"So, What's It About?" 

Set in the 1920's, Thirst is about three people trapped on a raft in the middle of the ocean after the ship they were on sinks.  With a small about of tweaking, we want make the play feel relevant to a modern audience. Our Director is inspired by the work of Alexander McQueen, Andy Warhol and Stanley Kubrick, and with a talented production team with an eclectic mix of experience, we hope to bring you this story of survival, violence and human contact with a unique visual style.  It's a little bit weird, and a whole lot of wonderful!   

"Ok, So What Exactly Is The Project?"

Our project consists of a 2 week professional run of Thirst at the Space theatre on the Isle of Dogs, South-East London from the 28th February - 11th March 2017. 

Running parallel to this, the Director will run a series of workshops which will be held at schools in the local community, in order to widen pupil’s engagement with abstract/expressionist theatre.  This will also equip them with new skills in theatre making.

A debate will be held at the Young Vic on the relationship between ‘art, race and theatre-making, does it matter who is on the driving seat?’.

"Great! What Do You Need?"

We need £1000 in order to afford:

  • Costume and props for our beloved actors.  We want the play to feel as authentic as possible, and we are sure they would be grateful to be clothed during the production! 
  • A Lighting Designer.  We feel that light has a very important part to play in the production in order to give it the perfect atmosphere.  How will you know what is happening if it is in the dark! 
  • A Producer.  We want the play to reach the ears of as many people as possible, and a marketing whizz is the perfect person to do this!  
  • And lastly, Rehearsal Space!

This money will also help us cover any admin costs we will come up against 

"But What's In It For us?"

Apart from being able to brag to your friends about how you are supporting the arts and careers of emerging theatre makers in this country?  Well take a look at our rewards on the right hand side of the page! We think they are pretty nifty!

"Sorry, I Just Can't Contribute At This Moment In Time"

We understand that not everyone can donate, but if you still want to support the project in some way, then we would love it if you could share this page on Facebook, Twitter, hell even Snapchat! Lets spread the word!

story:
Summary

Dangerous Women adhere to one common mantra, "well behaved women seldom make history."  As a diverse cast of artists, our goal is to bring the forgotten or historically repressed stories of important women and feminine archetypes to light on the stage.  

  • Our annual productions have grown for the last four years.  This year, with the outstanding venue at Snowy Owl Theater, we are able to stage and present in exciting new ways.  Please help us grow and honor women's history.

What We Need

  • $200.00:  FUNDED!  Materials, costuming and construction of the giant puppet "Mnemosyne" the ancient Goddess of Memory and patron of the Nine Muses of the Arts.  Memory is being created by a master puppet maker in our cast, inspired by the movements of the modern dance pioneer, Loie Fuller.  Memory is our storyteller, conjurer of mystical women.  
  • $300.00:  FUNDED! Voice over and sound recording editing for the voice of memory, which was written by our women's historian and is woven through the entire production.
  • $600.00:  FUNDED!  Misc Expenses for Materials, Marketing, Images, Promotional Video
  • $250:  HELP!  Partial cost of video production ($500 is total cost) to help us capture Spellbound, the 2017 production staged by Dangerous Women. Professional video content will allow us to continue sharing the stories.
  • $150:  HELP! Cost of Audio use for opening number, thunder effects and Memory theme music.  
  • $800:  Director's Stipends:  The entire cast is volunteering their time as professional artists.  Our two directors, however, have gone above and beyond in visioning, writing, promoting, directing, rehearsing and researching for the show.
  • If we don't reach our funding goals, all out of pocket expenses will be covered first! 

What's in it for you?

Be part of one of the most unique, universal and creative visions for women's history in the Pacific Northwest.  Many of our performers generate original content and contribute to the understanding of historical women and the discussions surrounding them.  

  • Our appreciation goes out to you-- as do some cool collectibles from the 2017 production.  Please see staged donations where you can choose your donation level.   

The Impact

Women's history is key to the continuity of societies.  It's invisibility is a loss for all people.  All people are made curious, grow and are empowered as a result of encountering brave, unique, visionary, female characters.   

  • Spellbound is the fourth annual production for Dangerous Women.  
  • We find that young women in high school respond very positively to our annual Dangerous Women presentations, as do audiences of all ages and genders, who learn and grow from experiencing our shows.
  • The cast's use of the arts is remarkable.  This year will include performances in poetry, visual art, belly dance, rap, drama,  singing, musical instrumentation, giant puppetry, Gregorian chant, hula, and comedy! 

Other Ways You Can Help

We are glad you've joined us here.  If you are not able to make a financial donation, feel free to help us by: 

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.  You can use Indiegogo share tools!

DEAR LOCAL CONTRIBUTORS:  THIS IS YOUR CHANCE TO SUPPORT YOUR FEMALE FRIENDS WHO DEDICATE A GOOD PART OF THEIR LIVES TO ENHANCING OUR COMMUNITIES WITH THEIR ART.  THESE WOMEN ARE EXCEPTIONAL!   DONATE AND SHARE IF YOU AGREE!  :-)

Mandi Wickline, Susan Gubsch, Nadege Margaria, Amy Carlson, Nicole Webber, Momi Palmeiri, Emily Kalehua Bebber, Rosalie Lokelani Ivanich, Trish Aloha Molina, Christiana Puamana Davitt, Carla Mele Stuart, Kara Woods Hunnicutt, Arlene Wagner, Susan Butruille, Cindy Rietveldt, Rhona Baron and Holly Blue.

story:
Who We Are

Hi there!

My name is Quinn O'Connor and along with my fellow students at the LA County HS for the Arts, we are putting on a production of All My Sons by Arthur Miller at studio/stage in Los Angeles. We are always told to make our own opportunities if there are no opportunities available. This is our chance to make art and showcase it to a greater population. 

With your generous donation, you can help foster our arts education as young artists dedicated to conveying important messages to our ever-changing world.

Where your donations will go

To put on the best-quality play for our audience and our cast, we need funds for the set, costumes, makeup, etc. Your generous donation will go towards helping our actors tell Arthur Miller's story in the most authentic way possible. 

Thank you so much for supporting our production!

-The Cast and Crew of All My Sons
